title: Occupational Health and Safety
primary_description: Improve employee safety and satisfaction in the workplace, and ensure your business is compliant with local legislation.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The skills to improve workplace safety, and boost employee satisfaction and engagement. The know-how to ensure business compliance with the requirements stipulated in South Africa’s Occupational Health and Safety Act. The tools to implement policies that improve company performance and profit by minimising the risk of workplace injuries. Knowledge of OHS that can be applied in a wide range of sectors and contexts. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The South African Occupational Health and Safety Act stipulates that all local companies with more than 20 employees must have health and safety measures in place. However, many businesses don’t fully understand their legal responsibilities or know where to start when it comes to health and safety management in the workplace. For this reason, occupational health and safety (OHS) officers are an indispensable part of any organization.

The Occupational Health and Safety online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will equip you with the skills to ensure legal compliance and create a safe, productive working environment for employees. You’ll learn how to conduct risk assessments, effectively manage workplace hazards and stressors, compile an investigative report, and oversee OHS training at your organization. Ultimately, you’ll leave with knowledge that can be applied across corporate and industrial settings, and a certificate validating your competencies in occupational health and safety.

Those looking to advance their career prospects and take a lead on OHS matters at their companies will likely find this course beneficial. It’s suitable for both professionals looking to break into the field, and those who already have experience in occupational health and safety and want to build on an existing qualification. The content of this Saiosh-accredited online course is also ideal for business leaders who want to ensure employee safety and satisfaction, and guarantee compliance with legislation. The online learning approach builds in both structure and flexibility, and students will receive support from tutors throughout the 10-week journey.

title: Data Storytelling and Visualisation: Communicating with Numbers to Inform, Persuade and Decide
primary_description: Learn to harness data visualisation to enable better decisions and communicate clear, powerful messages.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you will have gained:A “data mindset”: an understanding that problems in life or business can be better understood and communicated with data. Practical, foundational skills for bringing data to life through storytelling and visualisation, to illuminate, communicate and influence decision-making. A critical grounding in data visualisation, including how to select the best chart to depict different types of data while avoiding common pitfalls. Expert insights from top data journalists at The Economist and a range of expert guest speakers. Unlimited access to the official Economist Education alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional progress.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 2 weeks

Almost everyone works with data in some form. Understanding how to do so effectively is a critical skill in a data-rich world. But to get the most out of your numbers and present a clear and compelling narrative, you need the skills to draw out the story beneath the data and communicate it to different audiences.

Data Storytelling and Visualisation, an online course from Economist Education, ensures you improve your skills and bolster your confidence in working with data. It teaches you how to develop a “data mindset”: a way to think about problems in business and the world at large, and recognise how data can help you make better decisions. Over two stimulating weeks, you will discover how best to visualise different data sets, and spot and avoid common pitfalls.

People new to data and chart-making will gain a set of practical, foundational skills. Those who work with data regularly will benefit from tips on honing their data-storytelling skills and making simple but powerful data visualisations. Both groups will learn how to create a culture of data-led problem-solving, guided by The Economist ’s award-winning data journalists, and receive detailed feedback on their charts from course tutors.

This is a foundational course for people who review, analyse or prepare reports and presentations using data, as well as those who want to use data in decision-making. It will benefit professionals looking to build their confidence in communicating insights from data to various audiences. It will also be valuable to those with analytics experience who would benefit from advice on visualising and presenting data. This course is designed for leaders, managers and decision-makers interested in learning practical techniques, as well as analysts and analytics managers who need to communicate specialist information and insights to an audience with persuasive power.

This course does not provide detailed, technical instruction in complex visualisations such as videographics or the most intricate infographics. However, even professionals with advanced data-visualisation skills stand to benefit from the course’s insights into unearthing the story beneath data and visualising the narrative clearly and beautifully.

title: Economist Education Critical Thinking: Problem-Solving and Decision-Making in a Complex World
primary_description: Learn to use critical-thinking tools to thrive in an algorithmic age.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you will have gained:An approach to discovering, reflecting on and avoiding the negative effects of uncritical thinking. An understanding of narrative oversimplification, the availability heuristic, confirmation bias and constructive doubt. The knowledge to use critical thinking to analyse information, solve problems and make informed decisions. The ability to model critical thinking by challenging assumptions, asking good questions and reasoning rigorously. Unlimited access to the official Economist Education alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional progress.
tertiary_description:
In an increasingly complex, algorithm-driven world, critical thinking is a vital skill for everyone in business. Professionals must use data discerningly and interrogate the assumptions and claims of others. Only then will they be able to capitalize on their competitive advantages over machines and over peers less able to harness Artificial Intelligence (AI). All this means developing tools and strategies to avoid cognitive bias and error, to make rigorous arguments and to seek truth from facts.

Critical Thinking: Problem-Solving and Decision-Making in a Complex World , a two-week online course from Economist Education, shows learners how to interrogate assumptions, use data, and combat cognitive bias to make better decisions. The course’s first module explores how everyone falls prey to uncritical thinking, including narrative oversimplification and confirmation bias, and provides tools to recognize and counteract them. The second module emphasises the importance of rigorous arguments based on data and research, while guiding learners to reframe complex problems and harness diverse perspectives.

The course is guided by Dr Tom Chatfield, an expert on critical thinking, as well as senior editors at The Economist, and features insights from guest speakers including Daniel Kahneman, a Nobel prizewinner. The curriculum uses real-world examples, including The Economist’s editorial processes, to demonstrate the crucial role of critical thinking in decision making. Realistic scenarios and case studies challenge you to overcome oversimplification and faulty reasoning. The course encourages an approach to critical thinking that you can apply in your work, by fostering strategic pauses, self-reflection, investigation, and collaboration.

By the end of the course, you will not only understand your cognitive strengths and vulnerabilities but also gain the tools to make decisions informed by data, stress-test business ideas and interrogate assumptions in a technology-driven world.

This course is designed for experienced professionals and emphasizes the value of human critical thinking in a machine-driven world. Learners from diverse fields, such as marketing, consulting, and financial services, will learn to interrogate assumptions, use data discerningly, and identify essential questions that AI cannot. By embracing critical thinking, experienced professionals and aspiring leaders will be better equipped to stress-test business ideas, enabling them to avoid costly errors and make better decisions. This course is a must for those looking to stay relevant in the age of AI.

title: Influence and Persuasion in Business: Strategies To Connect, Convince and Lead
primary_description: Harness practical, ethical strategies to communicate better, forge agreement, and persuade people to act.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you will have gained:A practical framework for influencing and persuading others effectively in business. Enhanced communication skills that enable you to command attention, build connections and motivate action. Ethical strategies to navigate common workplace challenges, ensuring your influence aligns with your values. The confidence and adaptability you need to apply these skills across different scenarios, from workplace conversations to formal presentations. Unlimited access to the official Economist Education alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional progress.
tertiary_description:
Economist Education’s two-week online course, Influence and Persuasion in Business: Strategies to Connect, Convince and Lead, equips you with the practical tools to succeed in common workplace situations, whether you’re leading a meeting, negotiating with colleagues, or crafting a proposal. The course will help you master a framework for influence with three components: evidence, economics, and emotion. You’ll learn to handle resistance, build trust, and make your case effectively and ethically — upholding your integrity while advancing your career.

The program, created by invited experts and The Economist ’s journalists, offers a rich mix of perspectives. Steve Martin, a behavioral scientist, is the course’s founder; guest speakers include Andrew Palmer, The Economist’s Bartleby columnist on management, and business leaders including Sir Martin Sorrell.

Enjoy a free three-month digital subscription to The Economist with this executive-education course from Economist Education. Read articles on Economist.com or the app, listen to the weekly edition, watch videos, browse newsletters, immerse yourself in podcasts and join exclusive events.

This course is designed for executives, managers, and aspiring leaders to build consensus, inspire teams, and motivate people to act. Business-development professionals, salespeople, and entrepreneurs will sharpen their ability to pitch and persuade effectively. It stands to benefit anyone who needs to influence others — which is almost everyone in business.

title: Women's Leadership Program
primary_description: Identify your unique strengths and use them to drive network-supported innovation.
secondary_description: On completion of this this online program, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of your unique traits and attributes, which can be used as powerful leadership tools to help develop teams, drive innovation, and stimulate business growth. The ability to leverage your relationships, connections, and interpersonal interactions to achieve your leadership goals. A development plan that aligns your strengths, goals, and constructive feedback from your network. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Women remain underrepresented in leadership positions globally. To succeed, women must learn to navigate both the external factors that hinder their access to leadership positions and the internal factors that could cost them opportunities for advancement.

The online Women’s Leadership Program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education equips you with the knowledge and skills to develop your full professional potential as leaders in society. Through exploration of values-based leadership and emotional self-mastery, you’ll strengthen your emotional intelligence, understand your individual strengths, and learn to harness creative thinking to maximize the capacity for business innovation and problem-solving. Embark on a personal development journey and learn to utilize your distinctive abilities to help guide yourself, your teams, and your organization towards success.

This online leadership course aims to equip existing and aspiring leaders with the confidence, self-awareness, and networking skills to effectively lead their teams and organizations. Business leaders and senior managers will benefit from gaining insight into the behaviors that have the potential to shape future business, as well as leadership skills to effect positive change within their organizations. It’s also beneficial to middle and junior managers looking to gain personal and professional leadership development in order to prepare to move into a senior or executive management role.

Yale SOM Executive Education offers multiple online, on-campus and live-online women's leadership programs.

title: Oxford Executive Leadership Programme
primary_description: Elevate your leadership skills for the modern business environment and contribute to your organisation’s success.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:The ability to lead with impact in your business context. A refined understanding of your leadership purpose and how to align it with your organisation’s purpose. The frameworks and leadership skills needed to overcome modern workplace challenges and manage teams effectively. Strategies for driving change and preparing your organisation for the future. Guidance from leading industry experts and Oxford Saïd faculty, and unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In today’s evolving business landscape, there’s a growing need for highly skilled leaders who can navigate complex challenges and empower their teams to succeed. Combining theory and practice, this Oxford Executive Leadership Programme is centered around refining and developing your leadership skills and purpose in line with your company’s strategic focus.

Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll explore core leadership themes, including: power and influence, motivation, authenticity and adaptability, change, complexity, and diversity. Gain the opportunity to critically reflect on your leadership approach, while using practical insights, tools, and frameworks to lead high-performance teams in dynamic environments and through times of change.

Expand your global network online with Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, as you learn alongside a cohort of like-minded professionals and gain essential skills for the future of work.

The content of this course also forms part of the six-month onlineOxford Strategic Management Executive Programme, designed to help you advance as a business executive.

This programme is designed for leaders and managers at all levels who want to further develop their skills to overcome challenges and become a driving force for change in their organization. The content would support business executives looking to improve their leadership skills, discover or refine their leadership purpose, and make an impact within their business. It would also be helpful for those in senior and middle management who are preparing to move into an executive management role, as well as aspiring leaders who want to gain the confidence to step up.

title: FinTech
primary_description: Step beyond current FinTech disruption and prepare for future financial services priorities.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll gain:Clarity on the speculation and hype of the FinTech landscape, and the skills and knowledge to tackle innovation initiatives. An understanding of the technologies shaping the future of finance and the potential for partnerships between incumbents, new age tech companies, and investors. The ability to critically assess the future of FinTech and think strategically and creatively about problems faced by real companies. A premier certificate from Harvard’s VPAL, in association with HarvardX, as validation of your FinTech knowledge. The opportunity to network with a cohort of like-minded professionals at an additional conference week, and unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your FinTech career forward.
tertiary_description:
In recent years, the FinTech landscape has been defined by disruptive digital technology transforming banking and financial services. Since then, FinTech companies have successfully filled gaps left by existing financial institutions to serve customers’ evolving needs. The industry is now defined by innovation drivers, moving beyond disruption and towards widely adopted technology.

This online short course offers an up-to-date look into the maturing FinTech industry. It provides expert guidance and insight into the shifting nature of the financial sector and a holistic understanding of the technologies and innovations set to shape the future of finance and business. Utilizing innovative pedagogical approaches pioneered by the Harvard Business School (HBS), this course adapts the Case Method Approach used in on-campus programs at HBS for online study, presenting real-life challenges that reflect the complex, dynamic nature of the FinTech landscape. Equip yourself with the knowledge to tackle transformative initiatives within the financial technology sector, and earn a premier certificate from Harvard’s Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL), in association with HarvardX.

This online course is designed for business decision makers, financial professionals, and senior management professionals to better contextualize, interpret, and respond to the transformed financial services industry. It will benefit anyone within the financial technology and innovation space, particularly those wanting to adopt the creative methods and strategic approaches used within FinTech.

title: Oxford Private Markets Investments Programme
primary_description: Upskill yourself in the area of private markets with the Oxford Private Markets Investments Programme.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:The tools to operate confidently and knowledgeably within the evolving sector of private market investments. The ability to assess, acquire, and add value to private assets, navigate the deals process, and compile an investment memorandum. The knowledge needed to negotiate a debt package or limited partner agreement, and implement a private market strategy. A contextual grounding in real-world events and the skills to analyse current reports to ascertain returns from assets and funds. Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In recent years, the private equity industry has experienced unprecedented success, with a record amount of money raised, invested, and returned to investors.1

However, the techniques are specific to the sector and a nuanced understanding of the processes, terminology, and legal frameworks is essential for anyone looking to operate within it.

This Oxford Private Markets Investments Programme will help you build on your existing financial industry experience to broaden your knowledge of this niche sector.

Gain access and insight into the world of private markets, and learn the necessary skills to capitalize on new opportunities.

1 Bain & Company (2019).

This course is designed for finance professionals looking to take advantage of career opportunities in the emerging private market sector and upskill in order to remain competitive in the industry. If you’re a banker, investor, fund manager, analyst, trader, accountant, consultant, regulator or business journalist, you’ll benefit by broadening your knowledge of this niche but growing area of finance, and gain entry into the highly specialized world of private markets.

This Oxford Private Markets Investments Programme will help you build on your existing financial industry experience to broaden your knowledge of this niche sector.

Gain access and insight into the world of private markets, and learn the necessary skills to capitalize on new opportunities.

title: Oxford Women's Leadership Development Programme
primary_description: Overcome gender barriers and grow as a leader within your career and organisation.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:A personal development plan, and enhanced core leadership skills and resources, to help you grow confidently as a leader. Tools to help you navigate workplace challenges faced by women, and respond to culture and gender assumptions. An understanding of your unique leadership style, strengths, and limiting behaviours, and the ability to recognise your own agency. Guidance from leading industry experts and Oxford Saïd faculty, and the opportunity to learn alongside fellow women leaders from around the world. Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Time and again, the business world has witnessed the many advantages of employing more women in leadership positions. Tackling gender bias and workplace challenges is becoming a necessity for organisations, society, and the economy at large. The Oxford Women’s Leadership Development Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford offers you the opportunity to take a critical look at your own leadership style and strengths over the course of six weeks, online.

By approaching leadership as a reflective practice, this programme is structured around three main themes: self-acceptance, self-management, and self-development. Through challenging the workplace gender biases that female leaders face, you’ll explore the skills needed to lead, influence, negotiate, and navigate difficult scenarios.

This online leadership development programme aims to better equip current leaders to navigate the many challenges and gender biases that hinder female professionals in the workplace. The coursework is also designed to help aspiring female managers and executives develop the critical leadership skills to influence, persuade, empower, and mentor. Those preparing to transition into senior management or C-suite roles will be able to deepen their leadership knowledge by reflecting on crucible moments and approaches to challenging situations. This programme will serve those aiming to overcome gender barriers in business, and grow both within their careers and organisation.

title: Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme
primary_description: Lead sustainable business practices and contemporary forms of value creation.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:The sustainability leadership skills needed to implement climate risk management and facilitate ESG integration in your organisation, creating long-term value for shareholders and society. An understanding of how to formulate effective KPIs to measure the impact and dependence of your organisation on the environment. A personal plan for change that you can use to integrate sustainability strategies into corporate governance structures. Access to new insights and leading research from Oxford Saïd to help you drive positive change. Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Corporations are under increasing scrutiny for their contributions to society and the environment. Against this backdrop, a business strategy that considers its environmental impact is vital. There is increased demand for corporate leaders with the ability to drive sustainability and shift the traditional methods of value creation towards the concept of the triple bottom line.

The Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme takes an executive-level perspective on business sustainability, looking beyond traditional views of measuring and reporting on performance, to integrate environmental, social, and corporate governance (ESG) factors into your business practice. With a focus on corporate sustainability leadership, this course aims to equip leaders with the essential skills to address this critical business need.

Examine your corporation’s impact on the environment from multiple perspectives, including a view of climate change that accounts for risk, carbon emissions and natural resource management. With expert guidance, you'll develop the ability to drive effective carbon management strategies, while formulating key performance indicators (KPIs) for measuring your corporation’s sustainability efforts, and dependency on natural, social, and human capital.

Over the course of six weeks, you’ll gain access to expert insights and leading research from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford. Create a personal plan for developing, implementing, and leading strategies for achieving sustainable development goals (SDGs) in your organization, as you strive to effect positive change and reduce your organization’s impact on the environment.

The Oxford Leading Sustainable Corporations Programme is relevant to a broad range of roles across industries. This course is designed for professionals interested in actively leading and accounting for low carbon, circular and climate positive business transitions.

Whether you’re a current or aspiring business leader, or a senior professional with an interest in pursuing sustainable business, you’ll benefit from the insights provided by this course on communicating and implementing business strategies that enable you to drive positive sustainable change. If you occupy a finance or operations function, or work in the banking, investment, IT, or manufacturing sectors, an understanding of new metrics of performance and integrated ESG accounting methods will help you facilitate the measurement of your corporation’s environmental impact.

title: Accelerated Management Program
primary_description: Develop core management skills for tackling complex business challenges.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:The ability to apply analytical problem-solving to complex business decisions. The tools to develop a competitive strategy for your organization. The knowledge needed to calculate the time value of money and analyze financial statements, and to value a project or company. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In today’s evolving business landscape, there’s a need for leaders with the core management skills and knowledge to analyze and make complex business decisions across all facets of an organization. The Accelerated Management Program, from the Yale School of Management Executive Education, provides you with core skills and tools for managing a business more effectively. Through a unique integrated curriculum from a world-renowned business school, you’ll learn to overcome challenges across organizational functions, by understanding the connected elements of modern business.

Over the course of eight weeks online, you’ll engage with a raw case study (from Yale SOM’s unique directory of case studies) as you explore fundamental business management topics, such as decision-making using quantitative models, developing a competitive strategy, and leveraging social networks. You’ll also learn about the time value of money, and develop the ability to interpret financial statements and value a project or company.

This online management program is beneficial for professionals at early, mid, and advanced career stages. It will benefit managers who want to improve their strategic and managerial abilities in current or future roles. Senior managers, executives, business owners, and entrepreneurs will have the opportunity to sharpen their analytical problem-solving skills with updated knowledge from first-class faculty. For non-management professionals, this non-credit-bearing online course offers the opportunity to develop key business and leadership skills, validated with a certificate of participation from Yale SOM Executive Education.

title: Strategic Management Executive Programme
primary_description: Develop essential current management skills in leadership, strategy, and finance with content from three leading online Oxford programmes in a six-month curated learning experience.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to successfully navigate change and uncertainty using an integrated approach to management. The leadership knowledge to think critically about the current business landscape and drive effective decision-making. The skills to bring greater value to your teams and organisation as you lead them forward to achieve strategic goals. Exclusive insights gained from the research and experience of leading faculty from the University of Oxford and over 60 guest experts. Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 6 months (Including orientation and 2 week-long breaks)

To succeed in today's increasingly dynamic world, business executives need a holistic and strategic set of capabilities that will empower them to drive their careers, and organisation, forward in the face of complexity.

Gain the knowledge and tools to enhance your management capabilities and become a more effective leader on the Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme. This learning journey leverages content from three leading online Oxford programmes to provide you with core leadership, strategy, and finance skills to drive a competitive advantage for your company. As you progress through the programme, you’ll learn how to better manage teams, make more informed financial decisions, and achieve organisation-wide strategic objectives.

This programme offers current and aspiring leaders, senior executives, and managers the chance to enhance their ability to make an impact in their roles. These professionals will learn how to overcome contemporary organisational challenges and create effective strategies to leverage new opportunities for their business. Additionally, those looking to gain holistic and transformative knowledge, and a powerful long-term network that will help accelerate their career growth and broaden their professional impact, will find this programme beneficial.

The Oxford Strategic Management Executive Programme is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies.

Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. Oxford Saïd and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Oxford Algorithmic Trading Programme
primary_description: Develop the ability to implement your own trading strategies and demystify algorithmic trading.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:The ability to assess the efficacy of an algorithmic trading model within a real-world market environment. The skills to develop and implement your own algorithmic trading strategies based on the four key rules laid out in this programme. Insight into how automation, AI, machine learning, and emerging technologies will impact the future of systematic trading. Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
While algorithmic trading has been around for a long time, the rise of machine learning and artificial intelligence (AI) has substantially accelerated its course of development. This allows trading algorithms to find market efficiencies and better recognize profitable patterns of their own accord, making trades at a very high frequency. The performance of these algorithms, therefore, often exceeds those of professional traders and financial advisers.

The Oxford Algorithmic Trading Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford, equips you with a comprehensive understanding of the rules that drive successful algorithmic trading strategies and hedge funds, as well as a grounded introduction to financial theory and behavioral finance. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn four principles established by Programme Director Nir Vulkan to guide you through the process of evaluating an algorithmic trading model. You’ll also discover what biases are present in the market and how these behavioral traits create exploitable patterns. On completion, you’ll have the ability to assess whether a trading model or fund is worth investing in.

This programme is aimed at working professionals in the trading and investment space or those not currently familiar with the algorithmic trading platform. It will be of value to anyone interested in hearing from industry leaders and top academics on the key issues facing algorithmic systematic traders. The programme will also interest professionals looking to learn about the predicted impact of AI and automation on the course of financial trading’s future. Private and part-time traders who wish to improve their trading abilities and experiment with algorithmic trading models will also benefit from the programme. This non-technical programme features optional activities for participants interested in engaging in the technical side of algorithmic trading by discovering how to build a model using Python. These activities are entirely voluntary and run through an integrated development environment. No extra software is required.

title: Social Media Marketing
primary_description: Learn how to leverage key social channels to build brand awareness and broaden customer reach.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The knowledge to create social media content that aims to drive engagement and increase brand exposure. The ability to draw up and allocate a social media advertising budget. The tools to effectively measure and optimise the performance of social media campaigns. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Social media has transformed how businesses communicate with their customers. Once used predominantly for personal networking purposes, social channels are now recognized as key marketing tools, and organizations need sound strategies to properly leverage these platforms for promotional success.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Social Media Marketing online short course is designed to teach you how to develop such a strategy. It’ll introduce you to the South African social media marketing landscape and familiarize you with key principles and practical tools that you can use to boost your company’s social presence. You’ll learn how to manage a social media community and use social channels to drive sales and generate leads. Ultimately, you’ll walk away with a comprehensive social media marketing strategy that aligns with business objectives.

This course is ideal for anyone wanting to improve their ability to use social media platforms optimally for marketing purposes. Marketing managers, community managers, content marketers, and digital marketing strategists should all find the content useful. The course is also suitable for business owners and brand leaders looking for the skills and confidence to promote their companies more effectively online.

title: Payroll and Tax Administration
primary_description: Explore corporate taxation and learn how to effectively manage employee compensation.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An up-to-date understanding of payroll systems and tax procedures that can be applied immediately to your context. The knowledge to ensure organisational compliance with current legislation and regulations. The skills to calculate and allocate payroll, while taking employee leave into account. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Poor management of payroll and tax matters can cost a business significantly in both time and money, and is likely to frustrate and demotivate employees. Effective payroll administrators that are familiar with current legislation and best practices are, therefore, a valuable asset to any organization.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Payroll and Tax Administration online short course is designed to empower you with the skills to effectively perform these vital bookkeeping-related functions. You’ll be introduced to key concepts underpinning individual and business taxation, and gain an understanding of how eFiling and VAT returns work. You’ll also learn about different payroll systems and packages, and acquire the tools to manage employees’ remuneration effectively and efficiently to ensure a happy workforce.

As this course covers current legislation and practices, established payroll administrators, finance clerks, bookkeepers, and business owners will be able to update current skills and refresh their tax legislation knowledge. Those looking to develop their careers and move into the administrative, finance, or human resources function of a business will also likely benefit from this curriculum. No prior knowledge of bookkeeping, accounting, or finance is needed for this course.

title: Paralegal Practitioner
primary_description: Learn how to offer vital legal support by administering key technical and operational tasks.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Wide-ranging knowledge of South African law and legal procedures. The skills to conduct legal research, and interpret legislation and court material. The ability to draft basic legal documents and write an office memorandum. An official certificate from UCT as proof of your paralegal competencies. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As professionals who offer much-needed assistance to licensed lawyers, paralegals play a vital role in professional legal environments.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Paralegal Practitioner online short course aims to equip you with both the legal knowledge and the practical skills to fill this important function. You’ll gain a comprehensive understanding of the South African legal system, and be introduced to the Bill of Rights, the South African Constitution, and areas of private law, criminal law, and business law.

To give you a competitive edge, the course concludes with several modules on legal reading, writing, interviews, and research, preparing you to take on a wide range of technical and administrative responsibilities.

This course is designed for aspiring paralegals, legal assistants, and legal secretaries eager to unlock new career opportunities and work at a law firm or in a commercial environment. The content will also appeal to existing paralegal practitioners who want to refine their skill set, update their knowledge of local law, and expand their scope of influence within their organisation.

This course is designed for aspiring paralegals, legal assistants, and legal secretaries eager to unlock new career opportunities and work at a law firm or in a commercial environment. The content will also appeal to existing paralegal practitioners who want to refine their skill set, update their knowledge of local law, and expand their scope of influence within their organisation.

title: Tax Law
primary_description: Gain the confidence and skills to effectively manage your personal or corporate tax affairs.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the various facets of South African tax law, and the rights and obligations of taxpayers. The skills to calculate tax liability for individuals and businesses, and to fill in income tax returns. Knowledge of capital gains tax and how different types of trusts are taxed. A grounding in VAT and the tools to submit a VAT return. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As tax is an inescapable part of life, it’s critical that individuals, business owners, and finance professionals have a solid grasp of the principles of taxation and their related obligations.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Tax Law online short course seeks to demystify the world of tax administration by improving your understanding of the latest South African tax laws and their implications for you or your company. Guided by local tax law experts, you’ll learn how to navigate personal income tax, business income tax, capital gains tax, donations tax, and the taxation of trusts. The course is designed to equip you with the practical skills you need to calculate tax payable and file your returns.

Due to its focus on both personal and corporate tax, this course is suitable for individuals, entrepreneurs, and finance and legal professionals. Independent citizens can empower themselves with the skills to manage their own tax affairs, eliminating the need for costly external help. Business owners and consultants can learn how to run legally compliant, tax-efficient enterprises, and accountants, bookkeepers, and lawyers can refine their understanding of current tax legislation so that they’re better positioned to offer clients advice and assistance.

title: Artificial Intelligence: Understanding and Applying AI in Business
primary_description: Gain the practical skills and insights to use AI effectively at work.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you will have gained:A practical toolkit for using AI, including services like ChatGPT, in business. Insights into how businesses can use AI productively and effectively. A grasp of legal, ethical and regulatory issues surrounding AI. The ability to critically reflect on the future of AI, and how the technology will affect business and society. Unlimited access to the official Economist Education alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional progress.
tertiary_description:
Discover how to use artificial intelligence (AI) to stay competitive in the workplace. The two-week online course, Artificial Intelligence: Understanding and Applying AI in Business, offers practical insights from The Economist’s journalists and Tom Chatfield, an expert on technology and society. It dispels the myths surrounding AI and provides a clear understanding of how to use this technology effectively and ethically for increased productivity and profitability.

This course gives participants a comprehensive overview of AI, its potential, and its challenges. It cuts through the noise surrounding generative AI, clarifies the workings of large language models like ChatGPT, and explores their capabilities and risks. Using real-world examples, the course examines how AI is being used in business, offering both theoretical frameworks and hands-on opportunities to apply these concepts. With input from The Economist's science-and-technology experts and guest speakers, participants will explore what AI's growth means for them, for organizations, and for society.

Enjoy a free three-month digital subscription to The Economist with this executive-education course from Economist Education. Read articles on Economist.com or the app, listen to the weekly edition, watch videos, browse newsletters, immerse yourself in podcasts, and join exclusive events.

Whether you are a business professional seeking practical skills in AI or a leader aiming to grasp its broader implications, this course will give you a valuable foundation. The course also addresses the ethical and regulatory aspects of AI, prompting critical thinking about the technology’s future.

title: Supply Chain Management
primary_description: Understand effective supply chain management and how it drives competitive advantage.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A thorough understanding of the four key organisational functions in the supply chain. Practical knowledge of warehouse performance, reverse logistics, investment recovery, transportation, and packaging. The ability to design an integrated supply chain plan and measure its performance. The confidence to move into or progress in a supply chain management role. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Supply chains are the arteries of today’s globalized economy. In an increasingly complex and connected world, the supply chain has become a key source of competitive advantage. It offers opportunities to spearhead innovation, maximize profits, and positively impact your customers’ experience of your business or brand.

The Supply Chain Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) introduces the basic concepts of production, inventory, storage, and transportation of goods and services, and what is needed to manage your supply chains efficiently and effectively. With a focus on competitive gain, you’ll explore the four functional areas of supply chain management and how they can work to set your business apart. Guided by faculty, you’ll understand what an integrated supply chain is, when to implement a supply chain management system, and how to ensure you stay up-to-date with trends. Using your own context as a case study, you’ll design an integrated supply chain plan and assess the potential competitive advantage of its implementation.

This course is aimed at anyone seeking to grow their supply chain management knowledge and skills to remain relevant and unlock new career opportunities. It’s particularly suited to individuals already working in the areas of logistics, warehousing, transportation, inventory control, purchasing, marketing, sales, customer service, and retail. It’s also applicable to business owners or entrepreneurs who want to increase the efficiency of their supply chain functions.

title: Data Science with Python
primary_description: Gain meaningful insights from data to inform your decision making.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to apply data science and analysis techniques to inform decision-making. The tools to build and modify robust models in order to help solve business problems. A practical grounding in the widely used Jupyter Notebook. The ability to fit data to a model using Python in order to gain insight into business problems. A certificate of completion from UCT as validation of your new data science skill set, and unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In a world that’s increasingly data-driven, organizations need professionals who can extract meaningful insights from data to make better business decisions.

On the Data Science with Python online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT), you’ll have the opportunity to develop practical data science and analysis skills for use in everyday business scenarios. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll cover widely applicable Python libraries and learn how these methods can be, and are, used in day-to-day business situations.

Gain an introduction into statistical learning, which will provide a foundation on the mechanics of machine learning. You’ll explore supervised learning using tree-based models and neural networks, as well as unsupervised learning using K-means and hierarchical clustering. You’ll also learn about the process of revealing more robust patterns to ensure models are useful.

This course is aimed at professionals who want to close any gaps they may have in their data science skills and knowledge. IT professionals who need to rapidly enhance their data science toolkit with demonstrable and practical skills would benefit from the technical nature of the content. Professionals working in a variety of industries will learn how to increase efficiencies and identify new opportunities for their organization with key data and programming skills.

This course is technical in nature. It is strongly recommended that you have a basic understanding of mathematics, statistics, and at least one programming language if you wish to reap the full benefits of the course.

title: Data Analysis
primary_description: Learn how to sort, analyse, and interpret data to inform business strategy.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of how data analysis can be used to address a wide variety of business needs. A theoretical grasp of databases, and familiarity with a range of different data analysis techniques. The practical skills to sort, manipulate, analyse, visualise, and interpret data using Microsoft Excel. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
With more and more businesses relying on statistical analysis to drive decision-making, the ability to extract meaning from data has become a highly valued skill. Data analysts play a key role in helping business leaders make informed choices, distinguish between effective and ineffective practices, cut costs, and solve key problems — they are, therefore, an integral part of any successful organizational team.

The Data Analysis online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will introduce you to the fundamentals of data analysis and the broader potential of analytics in business. Over the course of eight modules, you’ll learn how data is collected, stored, organized, analysed, and interpreted, and you’ll be given the chance to practice data analysis techniques on real-world data sets. Ultimately, you’ll walk away with practical skills that you can apply immediately in your organization to address specific business needs in the areas of finance, sales, marketing, operational management, and human resource management.

Anyone interested in moving into the realms of data science and analytics will find this UCT online short course useful. The content is geared towards those eager to update their skill sets to remain relevant, as well as established professionals looking to unlock new opportunities within or outside their current organizations. Data analysts, and others who already work with data, can add to existing certifications by learning how to better leverage numbers to achieve results and drive growth. Students will need access to Microsoft Excel to complete the practical components of the course.

title: Human Resource (HR) Management
primary_description: Gain a competitive advantage by attracting, engaging, and retaining top talent.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The theoretical knowledge and practical skills to design and implement HR policies and procedures. The ability to create an empowering work environment to maximise and align workforce efforts to achieve business goals. The tools to design a recruitment and selection process, and develop effective retention strategies. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Employees are the lifeblood of an organization. Consequently, how staff members are selected, managed, motivated, and trained can have a significant impact on a business’s bottom line. As the professionals tasked with overseeing a company’s workforce, human resource managers are widely recognizsed as a vital cog in the broader business machine.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Human Resource (HR) Management online short course is designed to develop your ability to efficiently manage people. Taking a highly practical approach, the course equips you with the latest HR management knowledge, focusing on employment legislation, recruitment, performance management, and employee well-being. It aims to teach you practical skills that you can apply immediately to improve your practice.

Guided by a dedicated head tutor and support team, you’ll learn how to use strategic HR management to help your organization move closer to its goals.

This course is suitable for professionals who want to learn how to practically implement effective HR management strategies and plans in any industry or organization. The content is especially suited to current and aspiring HR administrators, talent managers, training and development professionals, and team leaders. In addition, it’s likely to be beneficial for small business owners and entrepreneurs looking to improve their ability to recruit and manage personnel.

title: Fundamentals of Financial Management
primary_description: Gain a foundation in business finance and the tools to help your organization thrive.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to assess the financial needs of your business. The confidence to make strategic business decisions. The skills to implement budgeting and forecasting techniques. A certificate of completion from UCT. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
One of a business's best chances at success lies in how it manages its financial resources. Financial management is an integral function of every business, and it ensures responsible investment decisions and the long-term sustainability of operations.

Maintain the financial wellbeing of your organization on the eight-week Fundamentals of Financial Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). No matter your business, role or position, this course will improve your understanding and practice of finance by exploring financial management through the lens of retail, manufacturing, service, and tech-based industries. The course aims to empower you with a financial toolkit to manage both the short- and long-term financial needs of your company, preparing you to make informed, strategic decisions.

This course is designed to equip mid to senior managers, directors, and administrators with an understanding of business finance and how financial management can be used to support the success of an organization. These professionals are looking to add value to their business by incorporating financial data into their strategic decision making. Students will also gain the knowledge to apply financial management tools within operational and strategic business processes. Aspiring managers and entrepreneurs with minimal experience in finance will learn to bolster the efficiency of a business through responsible financial management practices.

title: Graphic Design
primary_description: Develop the creative, technical, and business skills needed to launch your career in graphic design.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of visual communication and aesthetic principles, including theories about layout and composition. The creative and technical knowledge to produce designs for both print and digital mediums. The knowledge to produce designs for both print and digital mediums. Practical business skills that can be applied in a design-oriented career. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Most organisations will, at some point, require the skills of a graphic designer. Professionals in this field play an integral role in enhancing a brand’s visual presence, and are highly valued for their ability to convey meaning through visual elements.

This Graphic Design online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) will provide you with the technical skills and creative knowledge needed to make a start in this profession. Guided by a media expert, you’ll develop a basic understanding of how to use Adobe Illustrator,* learn to work with digital images, and explore how to choose effective typefaces to create compelling content for both print and web platforms. As you gain design knowledge and proficiency in the relevant software, you’ll also learn more about the business of graphic design and how to create a professional portfolio.

*GetSmarter won’t provide the software needed for this course; you’ll be responsible for ensuring you have access to it.

This course is aimed at anyone considering graphic design as a new career opportunity. The content offers an introduction to the subject matter, and aims to equip students with a strong foundation in visual communications. Those looking to refresh existing graphic design knowledge may also find this course beneficial. There are no formal prerequisites for registration.

title: Business Systems Analysis
primary_description: Create business change by improving management’s understanding of technical solutions, and developing your IT team’s awareness of organisational goals.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the fundamentals of business systems analysis and the role of a systems analyst. The ability to analyse existing business processes and propose effective solutions to enhance company productivity, profitability, and efficiency. A set of workplace-ready skills that will help you excel in your current role and potentially take on additional responsibilities. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In today’s fast-paced world, businesses that fail to leverage technology and adapt to changing conditions are less likely to reach their objectives. This has led to a greater demand for professionals who can identify the need for change and facilitate the design and implementation of process solutions. Additionally, business systems analysts play a vital role in bridging IT and leadership teams by guiding management toward understanding technical solutions, and equipping IT professionals to identify organisational goals.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Business Systems Analysis online short course explores how a variety of business systems analysis theories can be used to examine existing processes and implement change in a practical, effective way. Gain the skills to leverage IT business systems and technological tools as an analyst, and impact your organisation’s overall success and efficiency. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll learn the fundamentals of business systems analysis, identify system requirements, and translate these into project specifications and user-friendly solutions that support the strategic objectives of a business.

This course is suitable for individuals who are new to business systems analysis as well as experienced employees who would like to formalise their expertise and keep their skills current in a competitive environment. Established IT professionals and business systems analysts will be able to sharpen their tool kit and earn a certificate of completion online from Africa’s leading university.1 Additionally, those individuals who are outside of the field but eager to leverage technical and business-oriented strategies to transform the way their company operates will find this course especially valuable.

Through this course, professionals can enable career development by building practical techniques such as data modelling to design IT systems, data analysis to understand vital trends, and stakeholder communication to align and achieve business objectives.

There are no formal prerequisites for this course, and the flexible online learning framework ensures that students are adequately supported to complete their studies on a part-time basis.

1 QS Top Universities (Apr, 2021).

tertiary_description.value:
In today’s fast-paced world, businesses that fail to leverage technology and adapt to changing conditions are less likely to reach their objectives. This has led to a greater demand for professionals who can identify the need for change and facilitate the design and implementation of process solutions. Additionally, business systems analysts play a vital role in bridging IT and leadership teams by guiding management toward understanding technical solutions, and equipping IT professionals to identify organisational goals.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Business Systems Analysis online short course explores how a variety of business systems analysis theories can be used to examine existing processes and implement change in a practical, effective way. Gain the skills to leverage IT business systems and technological tools as an analyst, and impact your organisation’s overall success and efficiency. Over the course of 10 weeks, you’ll learn the fundamentals of business systems analysis, identify system requirements, and translate these into project specifications and user-friendly solutions that support the strategic objectives of a business.

This course is suitable for individuals who are new to business systems analysis as well as experienced employees who would like to formalise their expertise and keep their skills current in a competitive environment. Established IT professionals and business systems analysts will be able to sharpen their tool kit and earn a certificate of completion online from Africa’s leading university.1 Additionally, those individuals who are outside of the field but eager to leverage technical and business-oriented strategies to transform the way their company operates will find this course especially valuable.

Through this course, professionals can enable career development by building practical techniques such as data modelling to design IT systems, data analysis to understand vital trends, and stakeholder communication to align and achieve business objectives.

There are no formal prerequisites for this course, and the flexible online learning framework ensures that students are adequately supported to complete their studies on a part-time basis.

1 QS Top Universities (Apr, 2021).

title: Business Risk Management
primary_description: Develop the ability to analyze, mitigate, and respond to organizational risk.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to compile a risk report and risk management framework for a business. The skills to identify, assess, prioritise and manage potential risks facing a project or company. The knowledge to create your own risk register to show a board of directors or potential investors. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The business world is still reeling from the sudden onset of COVID-19. In this new environment, risk assessment and the ability to implement a reliable risk management strategy has become vital to navigating the increasing volatility.

This Business Risk Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) is designed to give you a comprehensive overview of the burgeoning field of risk management. You’ll learn how to promote a strong risk culture in your organization and recognize the importance of industry compliance. You’ll also learn to leverage business risk management frameworks to determine the risk severity, and evaluate it using qualitative and quantitative factors.

Gain the ability to use a risk register to assess the viability and resource allocation of all of your projects and use reporting tools effectively to offer real insight for your business.

This course is designed for professionals in both senior leadership and risk-related positions. Through the course’s content, business leaders will learn to create a more secure future for their organizations by ensuring they’re compliant with industry regulations, and can effectively prepare for any potential risks they may face. Those working as compliance managers or in other risk-related roles will have the opportunity to update their skills with an understanding of best practice, and set themselves apart in an increasingly competitive industry.

title: IT Management
primary_description: Gain the knowledge and confidence to manage all facets of modern IT operations effectively.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A strategic IT management plan suited to your business context. Knowledge of best practices for modern IT management, and insight into budgeting and resourcing, value chain optimisation, risk control, and change management. An understanding of the latest IT trends in the areas of cybersecurity, DevOps, networks, design thinking, cloud, and IoT. The ability to use information and communications technology (ICT) to solve business problems. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Information technology (IT) plays a vital role in improving efficiencies in business environments. Its impact lies in its ability to facilitate new business models and provide richer ways of communicating with suppliers and customers. However, considering the rapid rate at which the IT industry evolves, professionals need to regularly update their knowledge and skills to effectively manage the disruption this field presents.

On the University of Cape Town (UCT) IT Management online short course, you’ll be equipped with the practical skills and tools required to lead your business’s IT operations. Experience a case-based approach to IT management that integrates core conceptual knowledge with practical, real-world managerial themes. Gain the knowledge to oversee IT infrastructure and processes, and guide an IT team through the challenges presented by digital transformation.

This highly practical course is suited to both aspiring and established IT managers looking to create business value through IT systems in any industry. Those already leading an IT team can take this course to update their skills and stay up to speed with the latest IT trends and developments. Similarly, IT administrators, officers, and technicians may want to register to gain new and relevant knowledge and improve their chances of successfully moving into a managerial role.

title: Web Design
primary_description: Learn the foundations of web design, and grow the confidence to structure, create, and maintain an original and responsive website.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The skills to write basic HTML code and style a web page using CSS. The ability to edit and optimise graphics and content for web use. An understanding of the tools and practices involved in responsive and interactive web design. A fully functioning four-page website that’s responsive and optimised for search. A certificate of completion from UCT as proof of your new skills, and unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As the virtual face of a company, websites are a key component of many businesses’ marketing and operating strategies. For this reason, organizations across industries value the skills of professionals who can create engaging web pages that set the company’s brand apart from the crowd.

The Web Design online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) introduces you to the building blocks of web design, and aims to equip you with the theoretical knowledge and practical skills to build a strong online presence for yourself or your company. You’ll develop a basic understanding of coding languages and discover how to test and publish online pages that render across devices.

Throughout the course, you’ll apply your learnings to produce a four-page website, and have the chance to present your work to peers for feedback in a series of group ‘crit’ sessions. You’ll walk away with the confidence to start your career in the growing field of web design.

This introductory course is designed for working professionals who want to remain relevant in the competitive digital age. Equally, it’s suited to anyone eager to change career direction or upskill in tasks related to web design, graphic design, art direction, and digital marketing. Individuals with existing web design experience can validate their skills with a UCT certificate of completion. Please note, students will be responsible for the purchase of their own domain names for this course. It’s recommended that you have basic computer literacy before taking this course.

title: User Experience Design
primary_description: Optimize website navigation and create an engaging user experience for customers.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A 12-month personal development road map that outlines your growth as a UX design practitioner. The ability to analyse a website brief and make aesthetic and functional design recommendations for an enhanced user experience. The skills to design paper and click-through prototypes, and run tests with user analysis samples. An understanding of how to work effectively with project stakeholders to achieve design goals.
tertiary_description:
Ease of use is now a vital feature of an effective digital environment. For a website or app to holistically serve its purpose, it needs to offer customers a seamless, intuitive user experience (UX).

The University of Cape Town (UCT) User Experience Design online short course enables you to understand how users interact with online content so that you can design environments that meet their evolving needs. You’ll discover key UX research and design techniques, and learn how to work with stakeholders, run user tests, design wireframes, and develop prototypes. You’ll also analyze current trends in the field, and map out a professional journey for yourself so that you can better leverage your new skills to launch a career in UX.

This course is suitable for anyone who wants to boost their understanding of online user behavior and walk away with tools to improve the usability of a website or app. The content is ideal for professionals who need to develop highly transferable, practical UX design skills in order to improve performance in their current position or who wish to prepare for future career growth. Those already in a design, digital marketing, product ownership, or web development role will further expand their knowledge and validate their existing expertise. No prior technical knowledge of coding is required for this course.

meta_title: UCT User Experience Design online short course

title: Marketing
primary_description: Learn how to develop and implement a holistic marketing strategy that incorporates industry best practice.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An integrated marketing strategy and the skills to roll it out while adhering to a fixed budget. Insight into market research and competitor analysis methods, and the ability to build a strong brand identity. An understanding of both traditional and digital marketing avenues, and knowledge of how to optimise content for various online platforms. The tools to measure the effectiveness of different marketing tactics and the progress of a campaign. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In an increasingly competitive business environment, companies need to make use of the latest brand management and promotional tactics to differentiate their offerings and attract target customers. Professionals with strong marketing skills can, therefore, play an important part in boosting an organization’s bottom line.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Marketing online short course covers the fundamentals of marketing management and offers a holistic view of this important field. You’ll learn how to set marketing goals, create buyer personas, and develop and implement a comprehensive strategy that incorporates digital marketing best practices while leveraging traditional channels. Throughout the course, you’ll receive detailed instruction from an engaged head tutor and have the chance to apply your learnings practically by making marketing decisions for a fictional business.

This course is designed for both current marketing and business development professionals who want to refresh their skills, and those looking for an introduction to the field. It’s also aimed at business owners and entrepreneurs who are eager to develop their marketing knowledge so they can better position and promote their own brand.

title: Construction Management
primary_description: Hone your ability to plan, coordinate, and supervise construction projects in the South African context.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the South African construction industry and the factors affecting the market. The skills to manage cash flow, the tendering process, and other practical aspects of construction work. The ability to evaluate health and safety risks, and reflect on environmental management practices for a project. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
With widespread transformation and infrastructure development on the agenda, the construction sector in sub-Saharan Africa is rich with potential. Success in this field requires sound planning, management, and coordination skills.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Construction Management online short course is designed to equip you with the practical skills to navigate the day-to-day management of both large- and small-scale construction projects. During this eight-week course, you’ll learn how to handle client relationships, address stakeholder needs, analyze health and safety risks, evaluate environmental considerations, and manage time and cost constraints. You’ll also gain a holistic understanding of the South African construction industry and the economic factors influencing it.

Enjoy expert instruction, and walk away knowing that you’ve completed South Africa’s only online, university-accredited construction management short course.

This online short course is suited to those looking for a pragmatic overview of construction management principles and best practices. The content is designed for both established construction industry professionals eager to formalize their knowledge and those who are new to the field. Site managers, contractors, safety officers, quantity surveyors, and junior architects may also find it beneficial. The course prioritizes problem-based learning and uses real-world case studies and practical exercises to prepare students for the South African building industry.
