title: Fundamentals of Cybersecurity
primary_description: Learn how to defend your organization’s systems and data against the growing threat of cyberattacks.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the fundamental principles of cybersecurity management and the relevant legislative environment. The ability to evaluate cybersecurity risks, and analyse corporate information security policies. The skills to design a secure network model and a suitable incident response plan for an organisation. Insight into cybersecurity software and hardware products, and knowledge of the measures that can be implemented to protect a business from cyberthreats. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The digital age has revolutionized the way that organizations do business. Unfortunately, however, it has also exposed companies, and their customers, to many new risks. With cyberattacks now a real threat in Africa and beyond, there’s a need across industries for professionals with the skills to address online security vulnerabilities.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Fundamentals of Cybersecurity online short course introduces you to the key elements of cybersecurity management, from both a South African and international perspective. Learn to become the defender of sensitive company data and learn how to make sound decisions to support your organization in both thwarting attacks and responding appropriately to incidents.

This course is beneficial for employees at all levels, both technical and managerial, who currently work within cybersecurity. Those new to the industry or within administrative or information security roles will gain the latest knowledge of cybersecurity and develop a competitive edge within the growing job market. Management professionals will explore the regulations and legislation that affects cybersecurity, and learn to develop dedicated cybersecurity training programs and incident policies. All professionals will have the opportunity to gain the confidence and skills to identify threats and implement the necessary measures to protect an organization from cyber risks.

title: Communication and Influence in the Digital Age
primary_description: Learn to engage attention in a media-dense environment and cultivate interpersonal skills through clear, effective communication.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A personalised communication guidebook to help you communicate clearly and influence at all levels, in person and digitally. Insights into essential aspects of communication, from critical thinking and persuasion to personal branding, cross-cultural communication, ethical leadership, and crisis management. Frameworks to mitigate the various risks that miscommunication can create. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In an increasingly complex global and local environment, where individuals need to cope with rapid change and abundant information, effective communication is crucial. The fast-paced and public nature of digital communication can mean a single misstep can lead to loss of credibility at both a company and an individual level.

The Communication and Influence in the Digital Age online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) explores traditional communication skills adapted for today’s connected and technology-driven environment. Led by UCT faculty and subject matter experts, you’ll learn to communicate effectively with your teams, stakeholders, and digital audience to improve trust, clarity, and goodwill.

You’ll learn how to navigate the current communication landscape through critical thinking, persuasion, storytelling, cultural awareness, interpersonal communication, presentation, and crisis management, all integral to manifesting influence and communicating successfully.

This course is aimed at professionals across industries who are looking to build their communication abilities — in person and online — to meet the needs of an increasingly complex, digitised world. In occupations where effective communication skills are required to engage with a range of stakeholders, this course will help to develop an interpersonal skill set applicable to the current communications landscape. If you’re seeking ways to influence and inspire others, build greater self-awareness and interpersonal skills, and communicate effectively, the course provides a practical roadmap to promote trust, clarity, and goodwill in your professional context.

Relevant to early- and mid-career professionals who need to engage with a wide range of personnel, as well as new or aspiring leaders who need to communicate effectively with teams, you’ll be compelled to assess your interpersonal communication skills and the value of investing in communication as a professional and a leader. No matter what your context, building influence is crucial for reaching your personal and professional goals. This course will help you develop your personal brand and hone your presentation skills in order to cultivate influence and communicate persuasively.

title: Advanced Business Risk Management
primary_description: Elevate your ability to manage volatility and uncertainty to support company performance.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The competency to assess a company’s financial risks and evaluate systems of internal control. The ability to recommend appropriate responses to a range of identified business risks. The tools to analyse the ethical, reputational, and governance-related risks facing an organisation. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Owing to widespread economic, political, ecological, and technological change, businesses of today are facing a broad range of risks that, if not adequately addressed, could threaten their survival. As a result, more organizations are realizing the importance of having competent senior risk management professionals on their side.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Advanced Business Risk Management online short course moves beyond foundational concepts to teach you how to not just identify and assess organizational risks, but develop strategies and controls to mitigate them. You’ll explore the management of reputational, financial, investment, and behavioral risks, and discover how to use insights to inform decision making.

As the course journey simulates the risk management process, you can expect a highly practical learning experience, with the chance to apply theory and best practices to real-world case studies.

Working professionals who want to build or further a career in business risk management will find this course useful. Established risk officers can update their skill sets and boost their knowledge of new developments to ensure optimal performance in their current roles. At the same time, those with business and management experience can acquire the tools and know-how necessary to shift into a risk-focused role. There are no formal prerequisites for this course, but financial literacy would be advantageous and it is recommended that students have either completed the UCT Business Risk Management online short course or are currently working in the risk management field.

title: Business Sustainability Strategy: Technology and Management
primary_description: Develop a strategy for driving positive change and sustainable business practices as you learn to navigate complex sustainability issues.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The skills to navigate complex sustainability issues, with insight from the holistic PROMISE framework that examines the impact of sustainability goals and choices. A strategy for engaging stakeholders in sustainability challenges and motivating for positive, long-lasting change in your organization. Insights from MIT faculty and guest experts on sustainability challenges within businesses, and an understanding of how technology can drive sustainability solutions. The ability to navigate the tension between implementing business sustainability initiatives and increasing financial performance.
tertiary_description:
With an increasing number of environmental regulations and concerns from consumers and stakeholders, the topic of sustainability has moved to the forefront of business endeavors. Yet, despite the demand for greater accountability, organizations still need to remain profitable. In order to have a sustainable future, leaders need to learn to address these inherent challenges.

The Business Sustainability Strategy: Technology and Management online short course explores the process of successfully navigating the trade-offs and tensions between sustainability and profitability. Guided by the MIT Sloan School of Management faculty and a host of guest experts, you’ll learn to pursue sustainability through innovation and behavioral change. Using the PROMISE framework as a lens to holistically examine business choices and sustainability goals, you’ll analyze some of the most prominent sustainability concerns facing modern companies today. You’ll engage in a range of diverse topics, including climate change, dematerialization, and the main types of market failures. After six weeks, you’ll walk away with a strategy for engaging others in developing sustainable business practices, with the skills and knowledge to drive long-lasting change within and beyond your organization.

This six-week program offers business decision makers and strategy drivers the skills to drive sustainability management and leadership in their organizations. Professionals who are responsible for moving their businesses forward will gain the skills to oversee sustainability initiatives and ensure ethical business practices meet organizational goals. Those involved in the day-to-day operations of their organization who hope to move into a leadership position will gain the knowledge required to drive new strategies or company-wide policies. Additionally, professionals with environmental knowledge will have the opportunity to align their practice with the business world and learn to promote the value of sustainability in the marketplace.

title: Organizational Leadership
primary_description: Gain the tools and understanding to navigate the complexities of senior leadership.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:A comprehensive toolkit of frameworks and models to produce highly effective organizational teams. A nuanced understanding of the organizational complexities and challenges associated with senior leadership positions. The ability to break down silos, shape organizational culture, and articulate your vision as you lead cross-functional teams towards the future. A practical approach to organizational leadership that leverages insights from real-world case studies to enhance your team leadership. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The increasing complexity of the modern organization — driven by changes in technology, the economy, and society — has resulted in a need for business leaders who can guide their teams through cross-functional intricacies. Success can no longer be achieved through an adherence to siloed hierarchies of teams and functions, but requires enhancing the performance of seemingly disparate parts within the organization itself.

The Rotman Senior Leadership online program from the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto offers you the tools, frameworks, and models to produce highly effective organizational teams. In it, you’ll gain a nuanced understanding of the complexities and challenges of senior leadership in order to lead teams towards a high-performance future. You’ll also learn to break down silos, influence business-wide culture, and manage change in your organization. Additionally, you’ll have access to Professor Hugh Arnold’s congruence model of organizational effectiveness, which will help you develop new ways of thinking about organizational effectiveness, and walk away with concrete, practical insights and approaches into the realities of organizational leadership in the modern age.

Focusing on frameworks and models designed to enhance organizational performance, this program will prove useful to senior managers across industries. If you already have experience as a senior manager, the program will allow you to enhance your ability to work across silos and manage change. If you’re new to management or making the transition into a senior role, you’ll develop an understanding of the challenges you might face and the complexities of senior leadership. If you own your business, you’ll learn how you can navigate organizational complexities and foster cross-functional collaboration to enhance performance.

title: Negotiation Programme
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Achieve optimal negotiation outcomes using practical skills and theories developed by LSE.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:A toolkit of key negotiation skills and theories to achieve optimal outcomes and create value for yourself and your organisation. The skills to think strategically about the impact of subconscious bias, body language, and other forms of nonverbal communication in negotiation. An understanding of how to improve working relationships and manage conflict. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Effective negotiation skills are crucial to success in any industry or organization. Great negotiators achieve results and enhance relationships by planning and tailoring their approach to the specific context rather than acting on impulse.

The highly interactive Negotiation Programme from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) enables you to reach your potential as a negotiator and enhance your business impact. Practice real-world scenarios with professionals from the UK and further afield in live online negotiations, where you’ll apply proven negotiation techniques in a digital environment. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll analyze different approaches to negotiating based on the communication channel, and investigate the impact of culture, power, and influence in negotiation. Finally, using expert insight and peer feedback, you’ll create a development plan to identify your personal negotiation style and provide an active record of your improvement.

Live online negotiation sessions will be between one-and-a-half to two hours long. You'll be able to indicate your time-slot preference for these sessions based on your time zone and schedule.

This six-week course is suitable for any professional interested in developing their strategic negotiation skills and confidence to become more influential, persuasive, and impactful. The skills you’ll gain are applicable across a broad range of industries and business functions.

The practical strategies and tools you’ll explore during this course on negotiation are relevant to both your current and future career. Novice negotiators will gain knowledge of new skills and techniques, while those with more experience will have the opportunity to hone their skills through an increased understanding of negotiation strategies and additional practice in live negotiation sessions. If you’re a professional, entrepreneur, or business owner who interacts with stakeholders, you’ll benefit from the practical nature of this negotiation course.

title: Interpersonal Communication: Strategies for Executives
primary_description: Gain the ability to effectively communicate with diverse teams, and across a dispersed workforce, to manage and motivate in the modern business environment.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Effective communication skills and strategies to help you manage remote teams in any business context or industry. Skills in active listening and humble inquiry, and an improved ability to give and receive feedback. A personal leadership narrative, and a range of tactics to effectively manage and participate in difficult conversations. Strategies to persuade external and internal audiences. An understanding of the significant impact of technology in the workplace, and the practices needed to communicate that impact in productive conversations with, through, and about machines.
tertiary_description:
Strong communication skills and interpersonal relationships are essential in an increasingly complex, dynamic, and technical world.

Communicating persuasively is crucial to inspiring and motivating others, and a requirement when leading a diverse — and often dispersed — workforce. This skill is also valuable when working with external stakeholders such as clients or business partners from abroad.

The MIT Sloan Interpersonal Communication: Strategies for Executives online short course combines research and practice-based methods to help you craft communication deliverables using the RELATE Framework — a scalable professional communication strategy created by the MIT Sloan School of Management. Throughout the course, you’ll also learn how to engage with various audiences and apply a strategic communication lens to understand machines in the corporate context.

This course is designed to support you in adopting effective personal and online communication techniques that meet the needs of an increasingly complex, digitalized world. Managers, entrepreneurs, and business leaders who need to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders will find value in developing their skill set and updating their communication approaches to meet modern business needs.

Similarly, if you’re a consultant, you can enhance service delivery by improving your ability to communicate with diverse audiences or via virtual or social media tools, as required by most multinational companies. If you’re looking to improve your interpersonal skills to match your practical expertise, for example, as a technical or HR professional who wants to better communicate with a team, you’ll find value in the strategic approaches covered in this course.

Strong communication skills and interpersonal relationships are essential in an increasingly complex, dynamic, and technical world.

Communicating persuasively is crucial to inspiring and motivating others, and a requirement when leading a diverse — and often dispersed — workforce. This skill is also valuable when working with external stakeholders such as clients or business partners from abroad.

The MIT Sloan Interpersonal Communication: Strategies for Executives online short course combines research and practice-based methods to help you craft communication deliverables using the RELATE Framework — a scalable professional communication strategy created by the MIT Sloan School of Management. Throughout the course, you’ll also learn how to engage with various audiences and apply a strategic communication lens to understand machines in the corporate context.

This course is designed to support you in adopting effective personal and online communication techniques that meet the needs of an increasingly complex, digitalized world. Managers, entrepreneurs, and business leaders who need to communicate with a wide range of stakeholders will find value in developing their skill set and updating their communication approaches to meet modern business needs.

Similarly, if you’re a consultant, you can enhance service delivery by improving your ability to communicate with diverse audiences or via virtual or social media tools, as required by most multinational companies. If you’re looking to improve your interpersonal skills to match your practical expertise, for example, as a technical or HR professional who wants to better communicate with a team, you’ll find value in the strategic approaches covered in this course.

title: Leading Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
primary_description: Gain practical skills to uncover the value of diversity, equity, and inclusion in your organization and lead transformative change.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Key tools to create safe spaces and foster constructive dialogue around diversity, equity, and inclusion. The skills to develop and communicate an effective DEI business case within your organization. Monitoring and evaluation metrics for promoting diversity, equity, and inclusion in your business context. Tools and insights to elevate your leadership ability and manage diverse and inclusive teams successfully. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As the urgency for a more diverse, equitable, and inclusive (DEI) workplace heightens, companies and individuals are seeking tangible outcomes that not only demonstrate their commitment to DEI, but effectively turn dialogue into action.

Diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace can’t exclusively serve business value: it’s an ethical imperative. In its capacity to foster innovation, creativity, and empathy, DEI achieves results in ways homogeneous environments rarely do. But it takes awareness, sensitivity, and collaborative effort to realize potential and to deliver on commitments to improve structural and social impediments to achieving an enriching, humane working environment.

Gain the skills to lead and manage DEI initiatives in your workplace in the Leading Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion online short course from the Weinberg College of Arts and Sciences at Northwestern University. Over six weeks, you’ll develop a holistic understanding of what DEI means for the modern business, and learn how certain initiatives can be executed to improve outcomes in your own context. Further develop your cultural competencies, and foster inclusivity to drive organizational value with insights from Professor Alvin B. Tillery, a thought leader in racial politics and presidential leadership.

This course is designed for any professional interested in diversity, equity, and inclusion in the workplace, including those who lead diverse groups but may not recognize specific DEI concepts, and those with experience in DEI initiatives who may lack formal training in this field.

Advisers and managers in the DEI space, and HR specialists, recruiters, and talent managers will gain a practical skill set for fostering inclusivity in their teams and companies. People managers and supervisors will learn how to harness practical leadership tools, communication strategies and metrics, and benefit from networking with a cohort of like-minded peers. Senior managers and C-suite executives will discover how best to diversify their workforce using the innovative CREED model, and find value in turning DEI initiatives into a strategic organizational priority.

The course’s learning outcomes have broad application across various industries, including corporates, government, nonprofits, and the wider public sector.

title: Organizational Leadership: Driving Culture and Performance
primary_description: Develop an adaptive approach to leadership to create a work environment that supports and drives employee performance.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:An agile, yet evergreen approach to leadership that allows you to adapt to organizational changes. An understanding of where your leadership input is most impactful and the ability to drive performance by improving the work environment in which your employees operate. An action plan specific to your organization that is ready for immediate implementation. Industry insights drawn from real-life case studies and the Program Directors’ years of research and experience. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Traditional models of leadership tend to focus on how leaders should behave, assuming that these behaviors and tasks will lead to high performance and success, regardless of context. In a simple and stable environment, this approach may be effective, but today’s business world is far from simple or stable. As the corporate landscape becomes more changeable and complex — with multicultural teams, hybrid working, competitive markets, faster product cycles, digitalization and AI — there is an urgent need for organizations and their leaders to become more agile and flexible in how they respond. They should pay attention to the context in which they operate, be ready to deploy a range of leadership approaches, and adapt as their business landscape changes.

Based on years of research by the Program Directors, the Organizational Leadership: Driving Culture and Performance online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) is designed to enhance your impact as a leader. It explains how you can achieve this impact by improving and adapting the workplace environments you create for your business and teams. You’ll be introduced to, and have the opportunity to create a Leadership Operating System (OS) built on the foundations of trust, clarity, and momentum. Over five weeks, you’ll explore the elements of the Leadership OS and discover how to use it to motivate people and set the tone for organizational culture and performance. Walk away with your tailored Leadership OS action plan, ready to implement immediate changes in your own business.

This program is aimed at leaders who want to prepare for, and become more effective in, directing and supporting others to achieve objectives. It would benefit anyone who manages people — regardless of industry or company size — who wants to help foster a better working environment, and a more resilient organization. Mid- to senior-level leaders will gain a new approach to maximize their impact on individuals, teams, and, in turn, overall performance. HR specialists, strategists, consultants, and aspiring leaders will learn how to prepare for the challenges of a more globalized, uncertain, and complex business landscape. This program is for all managers and executives who would like to enhance productivity, motivation, and innovation in a disrupted business world.

title: Machine Learning: Practical Applications
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Develop technical machine learning competencies to solve business problems and inform decision making.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The confidence to make more informed business decisions and solve complex problems by understanding how different machine learning models can be applied to a variety of data sets. The skills to implement various machine learning techniques, including regression, variable selection, shrinkage methods, classification, dimension reduction, and unsupervised learning. Upgraded mathematics and statistics knowledge, and the foundations of coding in R. Knowledge of the latest frontiers of machine learning, such as neural networks, and how these can be applied to your business context. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The convergence of various fields, such as data mining, statistics, optimisation, and computing, has given rise to machine learning, which is rapidly gaining adoption across diverse industries. One of the key advantages of machine learning is its capability to handle large datasets and solve complex problems. From commercial applications like search engines and recommendation systems (think Netflix and Amazon) to financial institutions for predicting customer behaviour, compliance, risk, and algorithmic trading, machine learning is proving to be a game-changer.

If you're looking to upskill in machine learning and its applications, the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) offers an eight-week online technical course that covers a comprehensive range of machine learning methods. Through practical case studies and hands-on exercises, you'll learn how to apply machine learning models to real-world problems and interpret the resulting predictions to make informed business decisions. The course is designed to help you build your expertise in modern business analytics and gain valuable insights into how machine learning is used today.

If you are a mid to senior manager, data specialist, consultant, analyst, IT, or business professional looking to integrate machine learning techniques to improve data analytics in your organization, this online certificate course is designed for you. This course offers an in-depth exploration of core principles and machine learning methods, which will benefit those interested in practical applications. Whether you are looking to upskill, transition into a data science role, or improve your understanding of business applications of data science, this course will help develop and validate your practical machine learning skills and knowledge.

Prerequisites

This course is technical in nature. It makes use of coding in R and covers the application of machine learning in business. Some algebraic and calculus knowledge is strongly advised, but is not required. Training in tertiary-level statistics and knowledge of a functional or object-oriented language are advantageous. HTML is not considered a programming language in this context. No specific software is required for this online certificate course.

title: Inclusive Leadership Through Behavioural Science
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Discover how behavioral science can be leveraged to create and lead a more inclusive organization.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Behavioural science insights that allow you to create a more inclusive organisation, with guidance from global inclusivity experts. The ability to identify DEI issues in the workplace based on real-world experiences. Practical interventions to improve inclusiveness in search and hiring, enhance teamwork, curtail behavioural risk, ensure inclusive opportunities, and enhance resilience. The tools to assess and evaluate the effectiveness of DEI initiatives within an organisation, as well as the skills to gauge the ROI of these interventions. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Increased movement and mobility of people has accelerated cultural diversity in the workforce. Organizations and leaders are positioned to ensure that employees – no matter their race, ethnicity, sexual orientation, or religion – are treated fairly. But in reality, ideas, intent, and action are often disconnected.

Inclusion in today’s workplace is an important measure that directly impacts not only the balance sheet, but talent retention. If, and when, employees don’t feel heard, accepted, or truly valued, they’re far less likely to remain at a company. In one study, employees who identified as ‘different’ were shown to experience greater burnout and felt a lesser sense of belonging.1 With trends like the great resignation in full swing, employers are in crisis mode trying to resolve the retention issues upending the job market.2 But increased pay and elevated role titles aren’t enough, inclusion is the essential third factor, and it starts with leaders who build well-being and openness into their organization’s DNA.

This eight-week course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) provides you with insights from behavioral science that will enable you to create a more resilient and collaborative organization. Leveraging an inclusive approach to leadership, you’ll learn how to implement practical and effective solutions to problems caused by entrenched bias, heuristics, and groupthink. With insights from Dr Grace Lordon, founder of The Inclusion Initiative (TII) at LSE, you’ll develop keen interpersonal and relational skills to improve search and hiring processes, mitigate poor conduct, and ensure career opportunities across the board.

1 OC Tanner (2021)__.

2 SHRM (2021)__.

This online certificate course is designed for managers who would like to better understand and lead their teams, and are interested in the behavioral science approach (which focuses on motivations, group dynamics, and attitudes) to overcoming barriers to inclusion. Leaders will gain the tools to create an inclusive organizational culture that promotes fair opportunities, while driving meaningful conversations about DEI in the workplace. Human resources professionals and project and operations managers with the intention of becoming an expert on DEI will gain the knowledge to improve their professional and leadership skills to foster inclusion and well-being in their teams. In addition, anyone who would like to shift their career focus and transition into the DEI space may use this course as a stepping stone towards a new position in this crucial area.

title: Beyond Smart Cities: Emerging Design and Technology
primary_description: Harness disruptive technology to design smart, sustainable urban solutions.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to leverage technological innovation to improve design, planning, and policy of urban living. Strategies for more effective land use, distributed energy systems, and alternative mobility. The skills to recognize and identify the challenges in contemporary city design, with solutions for healthier and more sustainable city systems. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
With more than half of the world’s population living in urban areas, there’s a growing interest in developing smarter, safer, and more sustainable cities that are responsive to their citizens. While smart city solutions typically focus on digital enhancements to existing urban infrastructure, the MIT Media Lab Beyond Smart Cities: Emerging Design and Technology online short course goes beyond optimizations. Over six weeks, you’ll explore ways in which disruptive technology can dramatically improve planning, design, and management of contemporary cities for a more resilient future. Guided by MIT faculty, you’ll discover how technologies like data analytics, artificial intelligence (AI), new urban systems, real-time simulations, and predictive urban design can be leveraged to realize more entrepreneurial, high-performance, and livable urban communities.

This online course is designed for professionals interested in urban planning and design, who are seeking ways to transform cities for a more sustainable and vibrant future. With a focus on technology and data, the program is particularly relevant to those who are focused on designing, investing in, and delivering smart city solutions.

title: Women's Leadership Program: Leading With Power and Influence
primary_description: Effectively harness your unique sources of power to become a positively energizing woman leader and changemaker.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:An expanded view and definition of power as a skill that encompasses both strong and empathetic attributes, and can be built up and adjusted contextually. A greater understanding of organizational power dynamics, and tools for thriving within existing structures while promoting positive change. Strategies for harnessing your internal power and utilizing everyday junctures to become a highly impactful, positively energizing leader. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

For years, power in the workplace has been associated with traits such as persuasion, charisma, and outward displays of authority and strength. This has caused some women leaders to disidentify with power as a concept, even undermining their own progression. However, as traditional productivity metrics become unsustainable in the face of growing burnout and disengagement, a new leadership approach focusing on well-being, purpose, and belonging is needed. Communication, empathy, authenticity, and honesty hold more value than ever before.

The Women’s Leadership Program: Leading With Power and Influence from the Yale School of Management Executive Education equips you to become the positively energizing leader to drive change. Over the course of six weeks online, you’ll discover a broader definition of power as a buildable skill set that incorporates both strong and empathic traits and can shift depending on context. You’ll explore existing power structures and dynamics in organizations, and uncover how a growth mindset can help you influence others and effect positive change in your sphere of influence. Guided by experts, you’ll also discover key strategies that can help you use everyday junctures for power and change, and enhance your ability to cultivate positive relational energy to promote organizational success. Walk away with the tools and knowledge to effectively harness your unique power as a woman leader, and an official certificate of participation from a world-leading business school.1

1 Yale SOM (Mar, 2021).

Yale SOM Executive Education offers multiple online, on-campus, and live-online women's leadership programs. This program is a natural continuation of the online and on-campus versions of the Women’s Leadership Program and the online Women’s Leadership Program: Leading Teams . Each can be taken independently, as a stand alone program, but they also build on each other to offer a holistic approach to leadership. View all Yale SOM programs for women and those who support them here .

This program will benefit women leaders, including those in the C-suite and entrepreneurs or owners seeking to generate long-term success. Mid- and senior-level women managers will have the opportunity to build their skill sets and networks to advance in their careers, and professionals such as product or project managers, analysts, and consultants will gain the tools to become highly effective and energizing leaders. Professionals from across sectors, such as business development, media and marketing, finance, education, and the public sector will find great value in the program’s insights. While the program is primarily aimed at women, it will also be of relevance to all who want to understand structures of power and support positive change.

title: Exercise Physiology
primary_description: Gain key scientific knowledge of how the body reacts and adapts to the stress of physical activity.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of how the body reacts and adapts to exercise, and ideas on how to enhance movement opportunities in the modern world. Insights into how exercise can affect health and slow the trajectory of aging. The knowledge of how physical performance is affected by environmental stressors. The ability to provide input and feedback on tailored training regimes. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Exercise has been shown to relieve symptoms of stress, anxiety, and depression, and help manage various diseases, yet only one in four Americans is meeting the recommended levels of physical activity.

The Exercise Physiology online short course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), part of Stanford Medicine, explores the fundamentals of physiology and builds on this foundation to foster a holistic, scientific knowledge of exercise and wellness. Over the course of six weeks, learners will gain an understanding of exercise science and the impact that physical activity has on slowing the trajectory of aging and improving general health. Throughout the course, learners will gain the skills needed to critique training programs, and suggest improvements to various physical environments, such as work spaces, schools, and cities, to improve health and wellness.

The nature of this course ensures that it’s applicable to professionals working within both the wellness and healthcare sectors. Learners will discover methods for improving the health and athletic performance of individuals, no matter their age, through an understanding of how different bodies react and adapt to the stresses of exercise. Professionals within the healthcare industry will learn about the impact that physical activity has on disease management. Those within the health and wellness industries will gain the tools needed to help their customers and patients achieve their fitness goals, whether that be weight loss, physical strength, enhanced performance, or healthy aging.

title: Oxford Real Estate Investment Programme
primary_description: The future of real estate is changing. Explore the megatrends and disruptions impacting occupier and capital markets, and increase the resilience of an investment portfolio in the context of shifts to come.
secondary_description: On completion of this programme, you’ll walk away with:A holistic understanding of the global megatrends impacting the real estate industry, along with the skills to strategically respond to change and increase the resilience of a portfolio. A future-focused view of the innovations and disruptions driving change in commercial and residential real estate, proptech, housing, and cities. The skills to design, develop, and pitch a new investment fund or product that will enhance a real estate portfolio. Industry insights from global experts and real-world examples, empowering you to make informed decisions and accurate appraisals of real estate opportunities. Unlimited access to both the official Oxford Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn and edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
From climate change to shifting demographics, pandemics and new technologies, the real estate market is experiencing significant change. The way we transact, manage, and invest in property is being redesigned as a result of global megatrends, innovation, and disruption. In the face of change, professionals are now being asked: how will you adapt your portfolio for greater resilience?

Gain insight into the future of investment and development on the Oxford Real Estate Investment Programme from Saïd Business School, University of Oxford. This broad, six-week programme explores the impact of global trends and forces on commercial, residential, and sustainable real estate, both now and in the future. You’ll explore a framework of theory, practice, and innovation, gaining a range of perspectives that empower you to appraise development and investment opportunities. With insights from industry leaders, and the Oxford Future of Real Estate Initiative, you’ll discover solutions to modern-day problems and become equipped to build a resilient real estate portfolio.

This programme has been built for professionals, executives, functional experts, leaders, and decision makers in real estate, finance, investment, engineering, and construction. It’s also ideal for those from complementary or adjacent sectors aiming to disrupt or transition into the real estate market. With a broad industry outlook, the programme will equip traditional real estate businesses and professionals, as well as those aiming to break into the market, with the skills to respond to industry change. Property investors and venture capitalists will learn to better harness opportunities in start-ups and PropTech, and be equipped to build resilient portfolios that withstand the changes that global trends, innovation, and disruption bring. Experienced professionals working in technology, business development, or real estate sales will gain holistic insight into a shifting landscape. There are no prerequisites for this course, but an understanding of maths and finance will be beneficial to participants.

During the programme, professionals will have the opportunity to network with industry experts and leaders from around the world. Upon completion, you will join the Saïd Business School e-lumni community and gain access to the Oxford Saïd Executive Education Alumni group on LinkedIn.*

*Access to this group will only be granted following the participant’s successful completion and passing of the programme.

title: Public Policy Innovations
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Understand public policy innovations and technology, and its strategies for transforming policymaking.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of how to innovate in the public policy space. The ability to address challenges and barriers that come with innovation and changing technologies. Knowledge of transparency mechanisms and how they can be leveraged in public policy formulation. Insight into big data and open data, and how they can be used as a tool for public policy innovation. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Policymakers face increasing challenges in public policy decision making. Innovation and technology offer the potential to transform policymaking into something more efficient, equitable, and successful. While the possibilities for innovation are significant, professionals in these spaces require the skills and insight to execute them effectively.

Understand innovation’s role in improving policy with the Public Policy Innovations online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE). Over eight weeks, you’ll explore the opportunities and pitfalls that different solutions present for the policy process. Armed with an understanding of these innovation tools, you’ll be empowered to propose new approaches to improve systems and navigate implementation. You’ll also learn how data can be used as a tool for policy innovation, and explore the opportunities and challenges technology like artificial intelligence presents for the public sector. Finally, you’ll leave the course with the skills to propose a new initiative to put policy innovations into practice.

This course is designed for public sector professionals interested in the cutting-edge innovations associated with public policy and public management. Given the course’s operational and strategic nature, it’s relevant to anyone in government roles seeking ways to drive innovation. Policy professionals in consulting, advocacy, local government, and international development sectors will learn how modern policy innovations can benefit their division.

title: Developing Digital Transformation Strategies
primary_description: Learn how to stay competitive in an increasingly challenging business environment by harnessing three distinct strategies for organization-wide digital transformation.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:A digital transformation road map, including three distinct digital strategies for successfully navigating change. The ability to develop clear and coherent short- and long-term digital transformation strategies. The knowledge and insight to select and leverage the digital platforms best suited to your business. A holistic understanding of how organization-wide digital transformation can be used to foster a competitive advantage. A work-ready action plan for immediate business application and a tangible organizational impact.
tertiary_description:
In an age of widespread disruption, where most organizations are concerned about the impact of new technologies but few feel like they’re responding adequately, digital transformation has become a business imperative. Successful digital transformation involves more than just the integration of digital technology — it’s an ongoing process, conducted at scale, incorporating careful planning, continual learning, and a cohesive short- and long-term strategy.

The Developing Digital Transformation Strategies online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) equips you with the skill set to strategically lead your organization through technological change. Over five weeks, you’ll develop a comprehensive understanding of what true end-to-end digital transformation entails, and learn to apply three unique strategies for the creation of digital experiences and transformation of digital functions and businesses in your own context. Leveraging Prof. Misiek Piskorski’s proven Digital Transformation Strategy Framework, you’ll learn to effectively harness organizational design to facilitate wide-scale transformation, as well as select and use the digital platforms best suited to your company. By the end of the program, you’ll be equipped with a clear digital transformation roadmap and a work-ready action plan to carve out your competitive advantage and navigate change in your organization.

This program will appeal to any professional who is seeking to lead their organization’s digital transformation. It’s relevant to individuals across industries, at all levels of transformation — whether not yet digitalized, currently digitalizing, or fully digitalized but yet to experience the benefits. C-suite executives, directors, and business leaders will unlock ways to grow their competitive advantage by developing a strategic roadmap for digital transformation, innovation, and decision making. Senior managers, strategists, and heads of functions or departments will gain the tools to remain relevant and valuable by positioning themselves at the forefront of their firm’s digital strategy. A variety of specialists, consultants, analysts, and managers will have the opportunity to network online with fellow professionals and advance in their careers. Existing technology specialists will learn to supplement their knowledge with strategic insight, and apply it broadly to their work.

title: Social Entrepreneurship
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Gain the entrepreneurial skills, tools, and knowledge to drive positive change and measure your social impact.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the key organisational factors to consider when developing a social organisation. Expert insight into what a social issue is, how to find a solution for it, and how to measure the social impact your enterprise creates. A business plan to guide the development of your social organisation, and the skills to drive positive change. An in-depth understanding of the need for greater social consciousness within government, business, and charities. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
A business-as-usual approach to social and environmental concerns is no longer enough. In an age of radical transparency and accountability, organizations need to do all they can to ensure they’re driving positive change and creating value outside of profit.

Gain an in-depth understanding of the processes, tools, and skills needed to create a socially conscious organization with the Social Entrepreneurship online short course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE). Throughout this course, you’ll examine the challenges and opportunities associated with social entrepreneurship, and learn how to develop a business plan that actively addresses social issues.

Over eight weeks, you’ll examine the key organizational considerations for founding a social entrepreneurship enterprise, and learn how to measure the social impact and value it creates.

This course will benefit a variety of professionals, including current and future entrepreneurs looking to start a socially conscious organisation. Those in a management role, especially within non-profit organisations, social-sector consultancies, and social enterprises will gain the skills needed to make a measurable social impact. Policymakers will gain the knowledge and tools to better collaborate with social enterprises, philanthropic foundations, and social-impact funders. This course will also be beneficial to any leaders, executives, or managers looking to support and address a social issue and embed purpose within their firms.

title: Women Leading Change: Shaping Our Future
primary_description: Understand the role female leaders can play as agents of change – in organisations, communities, and society – in addressing the systemic inequality.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:In-depth knowledge of the systemic challenges women face and the ability to lead change with confidence, resilience, and transformational leadership skills. An authentic leadership style and voice to create your personal narrative, and the principles and skills to communicate with influence. The tools to create purpose-led, psychologically safe environments, build strong relationships, and nurture teams for long-term effectiveness. An extended network and community of like-minded women, and a leadership action plan to lead sustainable transformational change in your sphere of influence. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Society is undergoing seismic shifts, yet women still face barriers to achieving equality. Many of the structural hurdles they face have been heightened by global crises and the resulting economic fallout. These factors only emphasise the need to increase the capability and confidence of women to contribute to building more inclusive, sustainable organisations and societies.

The Women Leading Change: Shaping Our Future online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) explores the personal and professional capabilities required to be a purpose-driven leader. Over eight weeks, you’ll expand your understanding of the challenges women face and the levers of change that can help to create more equal and just societies. Through tutor-led learning and peer support, you’ll enhance your ability to influence and drive transformational, systems-level change.

Learn from women leading change globally, in many sectors and disciplines, hear from leading practitioners and academics, and expand your network with the support of like-minded women from around the world. You’ll gain insight into creating psychologically safe environments, and develop tools to foster innovation and collaborations that drive transformational change. On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with a practical road map to drive positive change in your sphere of influence.

The course is for anyone ready to lead change in organisations and society through systemic transformation. It will benefit current and aspiring leaders in the public, private, and non-profit sectors, providing fresh perspectives and a forward-thinking mindset. It’s for those looking to gain practical techniques and strategies to further accelerate change through their work within and beyond. It offers a safe space for reflection, reconnection, and time to identify, challenge, and overcome self-limiting beliefs and habits. If you want to be a part of a diverse community of students and contributors as they learn, inspire, and grow, this course is for you.

title: Operations Management
primary_description: Develop the skills to navigate the operational challenges that exist in an evolving economy.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to apply lean thinking to strategic operational planning and processes. The knowledge to improve overall efficiency, quality, and waste management. An understanding of business operation risk and how to avoid it. The confidence to pursue or grow your career, with a certificate of completion from UCT in hand. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The Fourth Industrial Revolution – or Industry 4.0 – presents the opportunity for organisations to reconfigure their operations. Along with the rapid evolution of digital technologies and manufacturing processes, changing consumer preferences, and other developments such as a global move towards sustainability are supercharging business transformation. This ever-changing environment demands that companies run their operations as efficiently and effectively as possible. Sound operations management ensures that resources are used intelligently to maximise efficiency, profit, productivity, and success.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Operations Management online short course will help you develop competencies in production, capacity, supply chain, and quality management. Discover the 10 key principles of effective operations management and learn how to improve planning, manage the production scheduling process, and use forecasting techniques to solve demand-related issues. Ultimately, you’ll formulate a sound operations strategy using lean thinking and leave the course with the ability to make informed management decisions to drive your company forward.

This course is ideally suited to those currently employed in a business’s production or operations function, and those looking to launch a career in operations management. Professionals already working in this field will improve their ability to effect change in their organisations and boost performance in their current roles. In addition, individuals looking to move into an operations role will acquire transferable skills that could open up new opportunities across various industries.

title: Property Management: Marketing, Contracts and Administration
primary_description: Minimize costs and maximize rental income by taking control of the leasing and maintenance of your own or your clients’ property.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Insight into the business of property and how best to maintain and increase the long-term value and profitability of a property. The competence to administer a property portfolio, and prepare a budget report. The skills needed for successful property ownership, including tenant screening, strategic leasing, and managing stakeholder relationships. An understanding of how to use new property technology (proptech) platforms to solve real estate problems. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Rent earned from an additional property can serve as a lucrative secondary source of income, but in order for real estate to be profitable, it needs to be maintained and administered effectively.

The Property Management: Marketing, Contracts and Administration online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) is designed to empower you to assume the role of property manager and take over the maintenance and letting of a real estate portfolio. Develop a core understanding of the business of property by examining key techniques and principles used in the field, and learn how to navigate the practicalities of leasing your own property, applying marketing strategies, and leveraging new technologies to make managing your property more efficient. As you progress through the course, you’ll have the opportunity to practically apply each module’s theoretical learnings by managing a fictional building.

This course is aimed at both property owners and property professionals who manage, or aspire to manage, real estate. Private investors can empower themselves with the knowledge needed to excel in the business of property, while those working in the property industry can update and refresh their skills. Property administrators, real estate agents, and individuals looking to move into a career in property management for the first time may also find this course beneficial.

This course is approved by the University of Cape Town and is validated by the Engineering Council of South Africa (ECSA) for CPD credits. The course has an estimated 80 hours of learning and South African engineering professionals can earn up to eight CPD credits.*

International students need to consult their national professional engineering bodies to check whether this course is recognised for points towards maintaining professional status.

*Should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is upon you. The University of Cape Town and GetSmarter accept no responsibility. If you would like to claim validation or points, use the ECSA validation number UCTGSPMG23.

title: Brand Management
primary_description: Explore the principles and processes of building and maintaining a strong brand identity.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to construct and maintain your brand, weave a brand story, and integrate brand identity into all aspects of your business. Exclusive insights into what it takes to build influence and equity in a competitive emerging economy from some of South Africa’s most recognisable brands. A brand strategy directly relevant to your industry. Verify your competencies with a certificate of completion from the University of Cape Town. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Effective brand management strategies are invaluable to a business’s success, having a direct impact on its long-term growth and profitability.

Professionals following brand management career paths are responsible for the perceptions customers hold about their brand. They develop brand management strategies to create favorable sentiments around their products and organizations.

This strategic brand management course will allow you to learn from some of the brightest minds and biggest brands in South Africa, and give you the strategies you need to boost your brand management career in a landscape defined by digital and social media.

__

This course is aimed at brand managers, marketing professionals, or anyone who has experience, or an interest, in communicating a brand to customers and relevant stakeholders. Whether you are pursuing a new role or looking to validate and build on your existing skill set, you’ll benefit from this course by looking at how to build and maintain a brand’s reputation, tell its story, and cohesively integrate a brand strategy into your business.

title: Sports Management: Business Principles in Sport
primary_description: Apply core business skills and strategies to empower your career in the sports industry.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the business contexts within the sports industry, and the skills to analyse how key business principles can be applied to the sports context. A holistic business plan relevant to your own context, whether you’re a sports entrepreneur or interested in starting your own business in the industry. Future-focused knowledge of new trends and developments in the sport and sports management context, including eSports, competitor sports and development, and health and wellness. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Brought on by the growth of technology, changing consumer habits, and an eSports revolution, the sports industry is facing an unprecedented level of change. The transformative effects of these factors and how to respond to them require qualified professionals in all aspects of management, from marketing to sponsorship, events, coaching, technology, media, and administration.

During this Sports Management: Business Principles in Sport online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT), you’ll have the opportunity to refine your business management knowledge for use in the context of the sports industry. Learn sports-relevant business strategies and engage in personal reflection, as you build the fundamental skills needed for success as a sports manager.

This online course is ideal for professionals already working in the sports industry, and who wish to validate or update their business acumen within the sports context. Those aiming to enter the sports industry will benefit from the foundational combination of business knowledge and industry insight, while entrepreneurs who are interested in a new venture in the realm of sports will gain valuable understanding of the industry at large.

title: Executive Leadership: Leading From the Present
primary_description: Develop a people-centric, purpose-driven, and collaborative organization through conscious self-leadership and positive management.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The skills to implement conscious self-leadership, directed action, and positive management into your leadership approach. The ability to recommend practices that enable continuous growth, inclusivity, and a high-performance organisational culture. The skills to foster self-awareness both in yourself and your organisation to lead more effectively, and improve company-wide satisfaction and success. A digital certificate of completion from the University of Cape Town Graduate School of Business. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The rapidly evolving and uncertain nature of the current workplace has highlighted the need for putting people at the center of an organization to enable the three key pillars of purpose, passion, and performance. To adapt to these demands and survive, businesses require leaders who are inspiring, self-aware, and inclusive.

Gain the skills to become a more effective and conscious leader on the Leadership: Creating a People-Centric Organisation online short course from the University of Cape Town Graduate School of Business (GSB). By focusing on the importance of self-leadership, you’ll learn to strategically improve employee engagement and satisfaction, create a purposeful and collaborative work environment, and deliver high performance.

Over six weeks, you’ll also explore conscious leadership, positive management, diversity, stress management, and effective communication, and gain practical techniques for adapting your own leadership approach. Engage in an authentic manner, and explore your own strengths and development areas to build a more sustainable, people-centric organization.

This course is aimed at managers at all levels who want to enhance their skills to lead employees more effectively and enable them to achieve optimal performance. Young professionals who are interested in moving into a leadership position will gain the skills required to help their career journey along. Upper management, as well as recently promoted executives, who need to grow their career or set themselves apart from the competition will benefit from learning how to make a valuable contribution in their organization that aids success. Finally, specialists and experienced managers who want to grow as self-aware leaders will find valuable knowledge, techniques, and strategies on this course.

title: Digital Business Strategy: Harnessing Our Digital Future
primary_description: Integrate transformative technologies into your business strategy, and leverage their benefits to drive your organization forward.
secondary_description: On completion of this digital strategy online short course experience, you’ll gain:An understanding of the key features of digitization for business success in the digital economy, guided by esteemed MIT Faculty. The knowledge to identify new opportunities for innovation and drive digital growth within your organization. Effective strategies to ensure your business model stays ahead of digital disruption
tertiary_description:
The MIT Sloan Digital Business Strategy: Harnessing Our Digital Future online short course investigates the principles that frame research by esteemed MIT faculty and The New York Times best-selling authors, Erik Brynjolfsson and Andrew McAfee. This program focuses on a unique approach to finding a balance between traditional methods and new ways companies can harness transformative technology to improve best practices.

With an emphasis on enabling effective digital transformation, this MIT Sloan Executive Education online program focuses on the rebalancing of three key relationships: human minds and machines, physical products and digital platforms, and the core (centralized knowledge) and the crowd (decentralized knowledge). It’s through these lenses that you’ll explore the potential of disruptive technology for business, equipping you to drive innovation within your own organization. Throughout the online short course, you’ll be encouraged to apply your newfound business strategy insights to real-life scenarios and ultimately walk away with an MIT digital certificate of completion.

This digital transformation-focused online program aims to provide CEOs, managers, C-suite executives, and entrepreneurs with the knowledge they need to analyze traditional business strategy models, and adapt these in light of current disruptive technologies. It’s also valuable for professionals with strategic decision-making responsibilities across a range of industries. Similarly, it will be beneficial to any member of a senior leadership team looking for a transformation-centered course in order to stay abreast of how the global business context is changing.

title: Strategic Change Management
primary_description: Establish a competitive advantage through your organization’s ability to adapt to change.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:The knowledge to create strategies for change with the ability to design initiatives that are impactful and sustainable throughout an organization. Practical skills to motivate for and implement change in a business, while overcoming stakeholder resistance. The tools needed to create a company that is agile and competitive in a fast-changing marketplace. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In today’s constantly shifting market, organizational change has become unavoidable. Transformative technology, business innovation, and global competition have made adaptability vital for companies that want to remain competitive in their industry. This includes having managers with the ability to perceive change in the marketplace, and who are able to pivot strategy and retool an organization, not just to remain relevant but to thrive.

The Kellogg Executive Education Strategic Change Management online program teaches you how to achieve and nurture sustainable change in your organization. You’ll gain the tools and insight to encourage creativity and implement change plans successfully. You’ll also learn to maintain strategic and organizational agility by creating a learning-ready company and effectively manage aversion to change.

This online program is aimed at professionals ready to support their organization in maintaining a competitive edge through the anticipation and management of change. It will, therefore, be beneficial to senior and middle management who want to foster change in their company, as well as those in a specific change management role. While this program is geared towards those in medium to large organizations, it will also be highly relevant for leaders of small organizations who want to effectively manage growth and scaling. It is also valuable to seniors in the human resources (HR) department — those who are traditionally responsible for these developments — looking for deeper strategic insight into change management beyond their current understanding.

title: Making AI Work: Machine Intelligence for Business and Society
primary_description: Discover a human-centered approach to deploying machine learning and learn to use AI as a tool for inclusive prosperity.
secondary_description: Create a comprehensive plan for the resilient and rational deployment of AI as you work through the weekly modules of this online short course.A systematic approach to examining AI’s impact using a proprietary MIT, program-specific ML Deployment Framework. An AI implementation strategy, based on technical and strategic guidance, that works for individuals, organizations, and society. The practical steps to imbue AI systems with robustness and privacy, and an understanding of their potential vulnerabilities. Insights into the common pitfalls of algorithmic decision-making to help to mitigate bias, inequity, and overconfidence.
tertiary_description:
Artificial intelligence (AI) is used to assist decision-making in healthcare, law, security, criminal justice, social media, and beyond. The possibilities are near-endless, but AI isn’t without risk. It’s now clear that data-driven decisions can have far-reaching impacts on individuals, organizations, and society as a whole. These unintended consequences are often difficult to identify and challenging to mitigate, but doing so creates new opportunities. Given the costs and risks of AI investment, it’s critical that leaders proactively anticipate and address these issues.

The Making AI Work: Machine Intelligence for Business and Society online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management and the MIT Schwarzman College of Computing offers a systematic approach to examining the power and limitations of machine learning (ML) tools. Over six weeks, you’ll explore the vulnerabilities of AI and understand the steps needed to create robust systems with privacy at their core. You’ll also investigate the importance of human-technology collaboration in gaining a competitive advantage for your organization. On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with a proprietary ML Deployment Framework and practical strategies to redirect current AI and ML models to shape the businesses and society of the future.

This program is designed to equip business leaders with the skills and insights to manage the organizational and societal impacts of AI. It provides practical frameworks and strategies that address effective and responsible data usage, machine learning systems, and general technological advancements. Those in leadership roles in both the public and private sectors will be empowered to guide their firms toward responsible innovation. This program also bridges the gap between executives and technical professionals. Those who already have functional expertise in this area will identify opportunities to build better AI and machine learning models, and be further prepared to assist leaders in critical decision making.

title: Psychology of Addiction and Recovery
primary_description: Understand the science of addiction and discover psychological approaches to treatment and recovery.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the history of addiction and how perceptions of addiction have changed over time. An intuitive grasp of the neurological and psychological effects of addiction, and how this aids in the path to recovery. Awareness of how peer-based policies and approaches to recovery can be used to treat addiction, and how policy-level interventions can be used to address substance misuse in populations. Insight into biological and psychological approaches to recovery. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As a result of scientific research, we know that addiction is a disease that affects both the brain and behavior. These discoveries have impacted and improved our understanding of compulsive drug use, enabling us to respond effectively to the problem with scientifically supported psychological interventions. Treatment, recovery, and prevention of addictive behavior are now a global strategy.

Guided by Dr. Anna Lembke, the medical director of Addiction Medicine at Stanford University School of Medicine and leading activist in the opioid epidemic, the Psychology of Addiction and Recovery online short course from the Stanford Center for Health Education (SCHE), a part of Stanford Medicine, explores the complex relationship between doctors and patients, the science of addiction, and the barriers to successfully addressing drug addiction and dependence at a personal and systemic level.

Over the course of six weeks, you’ll evaluate how medications, approaches to psychotherapy, and peer support can enhance recovery, and how scientific evidence can be used to establish innovative addiction treatments. You’ll also explore the neurobiological factors underlying addiction, and how these impact intervention and recovery efforts today.

There’s been significant progress and expansion in the development of evidence-based psychosocial treatments for substance abuse and psychological dependence. This course, which is founded on new research, offers a platform to better understand substance and process addiction, and how these impact intervention and recovery. It’s designed for health and care professionals such as social workers, recovery coaches, and mental health counselors, all of whom will find interest in the practical insights into addiction and recovery. Additionally, physicians could benefit from exposure to biological, psychological, and social options for recovery management.
