title: Business and Social Justice: A Force for Social Change
primary_description: Develop an action plan to maximise your organisation’s social impact and drive sustainability and social justice.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An informed understanding of the role business plays in addressing social justice challenges and how business can be a force for positive social change. The leadership skills, knowledge and capabilities to drive positive transformation and make your business more sustainable in the long term. A strategic Personal Action Plan for your business to address social injustice and maximise positive social impact. An enhanced ability to make an extraordinary impact by engaging with your fellow students in a collaborative and self-reflective forum. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

__

For businesses to take the initiative in addressing social injustice, leaders need to acknowledge that their role in responding to these challenges is not only critical, but urgent.

The Business and Social Justice: A Force for Social Change online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) unpacks the huge potential of businesses to be powerful agents for social justice and positive social change. Over eight weeks, you’ll learn how to leverage your leadership position to drive positive transformation through your organisation. You’ll also explore new business approaches to social justice and intentional social impact interventions and create a Personal Action Plan that goes beyond diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) and corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives. Viewing your role through the lens of social justice, you’ll reimagine ways for your organisation to become a catalyst for positive social impact.

This is your opportunity to unleash your potential for extraordinary impact. By completing a course with CISL, you'll develop the skills, confidence, and network to lead change in your sector, organisation and sphere of influence to make significant contributions to society. Extraordinary change happens when passionate and inspired individuals share a common purpose to drive meaningful impact for the collective good.

This online short course is designed for professionals looking to champion social justice within their business and drive positive social change. Business owners, managers and leaders focused on sustainability, diversity, inclusion and culture will learn how to pursue projects, drive strategic cultural improvements and better the ways in which their organisation perceives and approaches issues around social justice. Both experienced and young leaders who want to create an impact and proactively respond to social justice challenges will benefit from the course material. Those from marginalised groups, such as women and people of colour, will find particular value in exploring themes that go beyond corporate social responsibility (CSR) and diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI).

This course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 65 hours of learning.

Note: Should students wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on them. The University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title.value: Business and Social Justice: A Force for Social Change

primary_description.value: Develop an action plan to maximise your organisation’s social impact and drive sustainability and social justice.

secondary_description.value: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An informed understanding of the role business plays in addressing social justice challenges and how business can be a force for positive social change. The leadership skills, knowledge and capabilities to drive positive transformation and make your business more sustainable in the long term. A strategic Personal Action Plan for your business to address social injustice and maximise positive social impact. An enhanced ability to make an extraordinary impact by engaging with your fellow students in a collaborative and self-reflective forum. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.

tertiary_description.value:
Duration : 8 weeks (excluding orientation)

__

For businesses to take the initiative in addressing social injustice, leaders need to acknowledge that their role in responding to these challenges is not only critical, but urgent.

The Business and Social Justice: A Force for Social Change online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) unpacks the huge potential of businesses to be powerful agents for social justice and positive social change. Over eight weeks, you’ll learn how to leverage your leadership position to drive positive transformation through your organisation. You’ll also explore new business approaches to social justice and intentional social impact interventions and create a Personal Action Plan that goes beyond diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) and corporate social responsibility (CSR) initiatives. Viewing your role through the lens of social justice, you’ll reimagine ways for your organisation to become a catalyst for positive social impact.

This is your opportunity to unleash your potential for extraordinary impact. By completing a course with CISL, you'll develop the skills, confidence, and network to lead change in your sector, organisation and sphere of influence to make significant contributions to society. Extraordinary change happens when passionate and inspired individuals share a common purpose to drive meaningful impact for the collective good.

Business owners, managers and leaders focused on sustainability, diversity, inclusion and culture will learn how to pursue projects, drive strategic cultural improvements and better the ways in which their organisation perceives and approaches issues around social justice. Both experienced and young leaders who want to create an impact and proactively respond to social justice challenges will benefit from the course material. Those from marginalised groups, such as women and people of colour, will find particular value in exploring themes that go beyond corporate social responsibility (CSR) and diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI).

title: Cryptocurrency
primary_description: Learn how to critically assess the viability of any cryptocurrency project.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Knowledge of cryptocurrency, its limitations, capabilities, and the way it functions within the economic environment. The skills to holistically assess a crypto project by understanding cryptocurrency within its broader context, and the ability to evaluate cryptocurrency’s economic implications. An understanding of the evolution of money, and how Bitcoin and blockchain technology operate in moving value via the internet. A comprehensive overview of Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies, crypto markets and exchanges, smart contracts, decentralized applications (DApps), and initial coin offerings (ICOs). Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Over the last decade, the highest performing asset class was not stocks, bonds, or even real estate, it was Bitcoin.1 Cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and the MIT-developed Vault have emerged as a new asset class that has seen momentous returns.

To navigate volatility, it’s necessary to demystify the real-world capabilities of cryptocurrency and its economic implications.

Enhance your knowledge of cryptocurrency, its limitations, capabilities, and the way it functions within the economic environment in the Cryptocurrency online short course from the MIT Media Lab. Taking a comprehensive approach, you’ll explore cryptocurrencies in comparison with traditional finance, and gain insight into how start-ups, financial institutions, big tech, and central banks are adapting to its emergence.

Guided by MIT Media Lab’s Digital Currency Initiative — as well as crypto industry experts, economists, financial regulators, and internet entrepreneurs — you’ll gain the skills to critically and holistically assess the viability of crypto projects, and understand the opportunities and challenges associated with the evolution of money. In six weeks, you’ll gain insight into blockchain technology, smart contracts, decentralized applications (DApps), and the broader environment in which cryptocurrencies exist. At the end of the course, you’ll be equipped with the critical reasoning skills to analyze the viability of any smart crypto project.

1 Fortune (Aug, 2020 ).

This course is designed for anyone seeking a working knowledge of the latest cryptocurrency developments and the skills to assess the viability of crypto projects, and is especially applicable to executives exploring new organizational needs. The program is relevant to both financial services and IT professionals aiming to gain a competitive advantage within their sector by understanding how crypto is actually being applied. Professionals and entrepreneurs from wide-ranging industries, who are seeking future growth or new opportunities, will also benefit from a comprehensive understanding of cryptocurrency and the environment in which it operates.

During this course, you will be provided with the information, knowledge, and frameworks to deepen your understanding of cryptocurrencies from a business perspective. You’ll also explore blockchain technology, how cryptocurrencies operate, and what value they offer in organizational contexts.

You will not be given cryptocurrency investing advice, or investment or financial advice of any nature.

title: Women’s Leadership Program: Leading Teams
primary_description: Develop your unique leadership style by leveraging your network, gaining practical decision-making tools, and harnessing everyday moments for impact.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:Practical tools and strategies to improve your impact and lead others more effectively. The skills of a future-ready leader, and the agility to adapt to the changing leadership landscape with confidence. A better understanding of your authentic network type, and the ability to strengthen and build your network within your context. A clearer perspective of women's leadership from a global network of professionals. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
No two leaders are the same. Each will have a unique approach and authentic style. The Women’s Leadership Program: Leading Teams from the Yale School of Management Executive Education gives you the tools to leverage your unique leadership capabilities. Over six weeks, you’ll focus on three cornerstones of effective leadership: decision making, networks, and everyday leadership moments. You’ll also equip yourself with practical approaches and tools, such as the Vroom-Yetton-Jago model, to enhance your existing skill set.

This online program combines live sessions and the opportunity to engage with a global network of women leaders as you explore the future of work from a woman’s perspective. Under the guidance of expert faculty and thought leaders, you’ll gain the skills and strategies to combine your existing capabilities with newly discovered strategies for influencing and leading teams.

This program equips professionals with the tools to navigate a continually changing leadership landscape. Senior leaders, the C-suite, and business founders will learn how to improve their decision making and develop their leadership skills while growing and leveraging their networks. Mid to senior managers will have the opportunity to enhance their skills and networks to advance in their careers, while aspiring leaders will learn more about what it takes to develop influence in their team.

title: The Leader as Coach
primary_description: Motivate, support, and connect with individuals and teams by coaching instead of simply instructing.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:A coaching mindset, helping you empower employees to realize their full potential. Skills and frameworks for improving your interpersonal relationships and getting the best out of others. Future-ready strategies that equip individuals and teams to manage complexity and change. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

As the business environment evolves, so too does leadership. Increasingly, there is a demand for leaders to connect with others and themselves, and to engage employees and teams with empathy, curiosity, and intentionality.

The Leader as Coach online program from HEC Paris equips you to excel in the changing leadership landscape. Guided by a renowned coaching expert, you’ll gain the tools to positively transform individuals, teams, and organizations with a more intuitive, intentional approach to leadership. Through a number of practical case studies, you’ll learn how to engender a culture of trust and psychological safety in your context. You’ll also discover methods for improving the quality of your work connections by fostering a more harmonious, engaged organization. At the end of six weeks, you’ll know how to design and implement your own leader coach strategy, helping you immediately assume a coaching posture in your workplace. Walk away with an enhanced capacity to thrive as the self-aware, empathetic leader coach of tomorrow and a digital certificate of completion from HEC Paris.

This program is designed for any leader seeking to embody a leader coach posture to support positive transformation in their organization. Those currently in, or aspiring to, positions of leadership or people management will develop their ability to promote trust, communication, and engagement in individuals and teams. C-suite executives, directors, senior managers, and business owners will learn how to unleash fresh energy, innovation, and commitment from their employees in the face of business disruption. Experienced coaches who already work with leaders within a company will gain practical tools for supporting high levels of organizational change. And external coaches or consultants looking to advance in their careers will acquire current, applicable insights to stay relevant and competitive. As this is not a formal coaching qualification, no prior experience or extensive time commitment is required.

HEC Paris holds the prestigious triple-crown accreditation from the Association to Advance Collegiate Schools of Business, Association of MBA, and EQUIS. Its MBA program is ranked #1 in Europe and it’s in the top one percent of business schools around the world.

title: CRISPR: Gene-editing Applications
primary_description: Understand the potential of CRISPR technology in the biofuel, agriculture, and healthcare industries.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to understand CRISPR technology and its potential application in the biofuel, agriculture, and healthcare industries. The knowledge to identify market opportunities and consider the ethical implications of genetic modification. The industry insight and technological understanding to better communicate your company’s potential biotech initiative to business decision makers. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
CRISPR shares the same space as blockchain and IoT payments as one of the most disruptive innovations of recent years. This gene-editing tool has already impacted industries such as biofuel, agriculture, and healthcare, with its global market potential growing exponentially.

The CRISPR: Gene-editing Applications online short course from Harvard's Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL), in association with HarvardX, provides you with a comprehensive understanding of the CRISPR Cas9 gene-editing technology, its vast applications, and the market opportunities that genetic engineering presents. With a specific industry focus and through real-world case studies, you’ll explore the applications of CRISPR in biotechnology and how it will assist the development of disease-resistant cultivars, improve food yields, and allow biofuels to become a viable alternative energy source. You’ll analyze the possibilities of curing inherited genetic disorders, treating infectious diseases, and advancing the fight against cancer. Equipped with industry insight into the ethical implications of gene-editing, this course will give you a holistic understanding of the CRISPR landscape and its future potential.

This is not a technical course and no lab skills or prior knowledge of genetic engineering is required to participate. This course gives a comprehensive overview of the CRISPR DNA editing landscape for investors or entrepreneurs looking for the knowledge needed to make strategic business decisions about this disruptive technology. Those working in biotechnology or pharmaceutical product development, sales, or manufacturing will also find value as the content explores the future applications of CRISPR across the economy. Professionals involved in policy and law can also benefit from building a greater understanding of the ethical considerations regarding CRISPR and genetic modification.

title: Strategies for Supply Chain Digitalization
primary_description: Identify opportunities to transform your supply chain. Learn online with a globally recognized business school.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:The ability to design a digital logistics strategy to improve your customer experience. End-to-end supply chain planning and optimization, including in the production process. The expertise to critically select and apply suitable digital initiatives to your unique business context for performance improvement. Insight into the strategic importance of a customer-centric supply chain, with a roadmap for a digitally transformed supply chain. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Emerging supply chain and last mile logistics technology is a major source of competitive advantage. Now that more efficient digital solutions have become available, companies can make greater improvements in supply chain performance. Combining digital applications with operational changes helps yield significant performance improvements that transform the supply chain.

The Strategies for Supply Chain Digitalization online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) will help you identify opportunities to streamline and optimize your business supply chain. Over five weeks, you’ll discover the best way to adapt your organization to new technologies and examine the digital logistics available to support a customer-centric supply chain, from strategic sourcing to production. Guided by Carlos Cordon, Professor of Strategy and Supply Chain Management, you’ll explore efficient supply chain network design operations and how to address changing customer needs. Walk away with a roadmap to digitally transform your supply chain.

This program will appeal to logistics, transport management, warehousing, procurement, and supply chain professionals seeking a better understanding of the opportunities afforded by digital initiatives in this sector. It’s particularly relevant to business professionals in the retail, wholesale, and manufacturing sectors. These roles include, but are not limited to, operations, project management, consultancy, business development, sales, engineering, and entrepreneurship.

The Strategies for Supply Chain Digitalization online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD) is accredited by the International Supply Chain Education Alliance (ISCEA). ISCEA is the global leader in supply chain education, certification, and recognition programs. By completing this program, learners will receive globally recognized skills in the supply chain occupation, networking opportunities with like-minded individuals, and discounted fees for Certified Professional in Logistics Management (CPLM) certification. For more information on the benefits of taking this ISCEA-accredited program, click here.

Please note that GetSmarter (part of edX) and IMD bear no responsibility for the claiming of these benefits with ISCEA. The onus, therefore, falls on you to do so.

IMD is a triple-accredited academic institution, with the Financial Times ranking it first for its open programs nine years in a row. IMD attributes its success to its unique “Real Learning. Real Impact” approach. Based in Switzerland and Singapore, IMD is led by expert and diverse faculty who use their insights, tools, and perspectives to prepare learners for the future of business. As an independent academic institution with a global reach, IMD strives to educate ambitious individuals and organizations worldwide.

By taking this program, you have the opportunity to accelerate your career with the IMD Digital Excellence Diploma. Customize your learning journey with 15 days of programs that are relevant to your digital needs and pass an exam to earn the diploma. See the programs here , and discover how participants are customizing their diploma.

title: Entrepreneurial Finance
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Navigate the challenges and opportunities facing today’s start-ups. Gain insight into the mechanics of business evaluation and learn how to pitch your business concept in the real world.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The skills to secure funding sources for your business using a pitch deck. The ability to evaluate business opportunities using a framework that considers people, opportunities, and context. A sound understanding of company ownership and valuation methods. The knowledge to value a business through multiple stages, and investigate scaling and exit strategies using an applied venture capital valuation method. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Shifting attitudes, new technologies, and a growing investment landscape are creating the ideal habitat for start-ups, yet two out of three entrepreneurial endeavours don’t succeed.1 Two major reasons for failure are cash depletion and the inability to secure financing or investor interest. Capital investment is available – as can be gleaned from the record $8 billion invested in UK technology sector start-ups – but it’s up to entrepreneurs to ensure that they have the skills to negotiate and pitch their ideas in order to secure funding from the right investors at the right time.2 Similarly, investors who are looking to capitalise on the budding start-up market require the insight to effectively evaluate business opportunities in order to make sound financing decisions.

The Entrepreneurial Finance online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to address both sides of the investment paradigm. Over six weeks online, you’ll develop the skills you need to successfully navigate the current entrepreneurial landscape. You’ll learn to critically evaluate business opportunities and explore how to match financing needs with the most appropriate investor type. You’ll be given top tips from industry experts on how to negotiate with investors and sell your business concept. By the end of this functional six-week course, you’ll learn how to develop an effective pitch deck to prepare for real-life pitch scenarios.

1 HBR (Jun, 2021).

2Financial Times (Mar, 2021).

This course focuses on both the investment and entrepreneurial paradigms within the venture capital sector. As a result, it’s aimed at a broad spectrum of professionals who wish to better navigate the funding and business evaluation aspects of entrepreneurship. If you’re a current or aspiring entrepreneur who would like to effectively pitch business ideas and learn how to access funding, this course will provide you with the tools and strategies to do so. As an executive or business owner, you can use the insights gained on this course to guide other entrepreneurs or invest in start-ups. This course will also appeal to those interested in pursuing a career in venture capital, as well as investors who are looking to upskill themselves.

Over six weeks online, you’ll develop the skills you need to successfully navigate the current entrepreneurial landscape. You’ll learn to critically evaluate business opportunities and explore how to match financing needs with the most appropriate investor type. You’ll be given top tips from industry experts on how to negotiate with investors and sell your business concept. By the end of this functional six-week course, you’ll learn how to develop an effective pitch deck to prepare for real-life pitch scenarios.

1 HBR (Jun, 2021).

2Financial Times (Mar, 2021).

This course focuses on both the investment and entrepreneurial paradigms within the venture capital sector. As a result, it’s aimed at a broad spectrum of professionals who wish to better navigate the funding and business evaluation aspects of entrepreneurship. If you’re a current or aspiring entrepreneur who would like to effectively pitch business ideas and learn how to access funding, this course will provide you with the tools and strategies to do so. As an executive or business owner, you can use the insights gained on this course to guide other entrepreneurs or invest in start-ups. This course will also appeal to those interested in pursuing a career in venture capital, as well as investors who are looking to upskill themselves.

title: Unsupervised Machine Learning: Unlocking the Potential of Data
primary_description: Redefine the potential of your unused data through unsupervised machine learning techniques.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to harness previously unused data within your organization to deploy ML models. The technical foundation needed to address business challenges and drive AI initiatives through representation learning. An understanding of the challenges, opportunities, and important considerations of generative models. The skills to evaluate and interact with existing pre-trained models and leverage these effectively in your organization. The skills required to build transparent and interpretable ML models in your context.
tertiary_description:
Training artificial intelligence (AI) models has traditionally required large sets of annotated data. As a result, small, uncurated data — which carries untapped value — is often left untouched. By leveraging cutting-edge developments in machine learning (ML), you can unlock the latent potential of data from unused sources to create competitive opportunities for your business.

The Unsupervised Machine Learning: Unlocking the Potential of Data online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management and the MIT Schwarzman College of Computing explores the technical and strategic considerations of unsupervised learning approaches. In just six weeks, you’ll study these approaches, their capabilities, use cases, limitations, and applications. You’ll learn to see the potential of your data — no matter its quantity or quality — and deploy AI solutions tailored to your unique data, problem, and business.

This program is designed to help business decision makers leverage opportunities created by unsupervised ML. Understanding how to leverage uncurated data, managers and technology leads will be able to plan new data acquisition protocols. IT and tech professionals looking for up-to-date developments in unsupervised learning will benefit from this program material, as will data scientists and analysts looking to strengthen their knowledge of the application of computer vision technologies.

The ability to code is not a prerequisite for this program. However, this program contains complex concepts that require an existing understanding and above-average knowledge of machine learning.

title: Corporate Climate Change Risk Management
primary_description: Move your business toward net-zero emissions. Develop the skills to conduct a climate change risk assessment for your business.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of climate science and the ability to measure various scope emissions and analyze the carbon footprint of your business using the Greenhouse Gas Protocol Tool. The carbon disclosure and carbon management skills needed to integrate climate change into your corporate strategy. Theoretical and practical insight into carbon pricing, carbon tax, carbon trading schemes, and the carbon credits market. The ability to improve climate-related risk reporting procedures and guidelines using the Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures model. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Global warming has caused an alarming rise in temperatures across the planet. To halt this exacerbation, the United Nations has called for all emissions to reach net-zero by 2050 — a feat that businesses can only achieve with credible actions.1

With a strong focus on the science behind climate change, the Corporate Climate Change Risk Management online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education equips you with the skills and knowledge to move your business toward a net-zero future. Throughout this six-week program, you’ll take a look at some of the factors affecting the need for climate change risk management strategies in business, international and national climate policies, the political landscape, and legislation. Designed to provide you with practical takeaways, this program will help you implement carbon management plans to reduce your business’s carbon footprint.

Upon successful completion of this program, you’ll walk away with the ability to design and implement a climate change risk management strategy in your business.

1 United Nations (Nd). Accessed July 14, 2022.

This program is designed for leaders who are interested in developing a climate-conscious strategy for their company’s business practices. Professionals in any field will benefit from gaining an in-depth understanding of the theory and science behind climate change and its impact on business. It will also be beneficial for technical professionals who would like to link their practice to the world of business and prove the value of sustainability in the marketplace. Additionally, investment professionals tasked with delivering socially responsible investments will find value in this program. This program acts as a complement to the Yale SOM Executive Education Corporate Sustainability Management: Risk, Profit, and Purpose online program with more practical and advanced climate and environmentally focused risk management tools for business.

title: Sustainable Food: Production and Processing
primary_description: Discover new models, processes and approaches for achieving sustainable food systems that can equitably meet the nutritional demands of an expanding global population within planetary boundaries.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A sound understanding of the past, present, and future of the evolving food system and of the most urgent challenges of modern food security. Enhanced knowledge of how innovative technologies, new business models, and refined processes can help build more resilient food systems. Practical leadership skills to drive organisational change, take advantage of opportunities in the market, and embed sustainability into the food supply chain. An ambitious Personal Action Plan for leading strategic action, fine-tuned and strengthened through meaningful collaboration with your peers. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Global population growth is placing unprecedented strain on already-stretched modern food systems. With the added pressure of a changing climate, creaking supply chains, and greater consumer scrutiny, the need to transform these systems has become urgent.

The Sustainable Food: Production and Processing online short course from the University of Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership (CISL) equips you to shape resilient food systems to equitably feed the growing global population in a challenging environment. Over eight weeks online, you’ll explore the different aspects of a sustainable future food system, and the micro-, meso-, and macro-level changes required to transform the way food is produced, processed, and consumed. With guidance from expert CISL faculty, you’ll discover new business models, technologies, and processes for embedding sustainability into food supply chains, and build practical strategies for leading this transformation in your own organization or sector. By the end of the course, you’ll have consolidated your learnings through a number of peer-centered live sessions and forum discussions, and will have developed your own Personal Action Plan for leading sustainability initiatives in your context.

This course will benefit individuals working at every stage of global or local food systems, from the supplier to the consumer. Agricultural professionals, including commercial and small-scale farmers, ranch managers, agricultural engineers or technicians, and agronomists will gain practical tools for delivering nutritious, affordable, and sustainable food to all. Those in the manufacturing, retail, wholesale, or service sectors, such as supply chain and procurement professionals, food and beverage managers, restaurateurs, and entrepreneurs aspiring to start a sustainable business will discover scalable models for achieving resilient food systems. And analysts, policymakers, consultants, and lobbyists working in finance, marketing, and public relations will learn how to clearly articulate the case for sustainable food production, processing, and consumption.

title: Economic and Political Development in Developing Countries
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Why have some developing countries become rich while others have stayed poor? Understand this form of inequality from a multidisciplinary perspective, and gain the skills to promote inclusive development across states, markets, and civil society.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A multidisciplinary, integrated approach to accelerate transformation through economic growth, policymaking, and civic engagement. A practical toolkit to inform decision-making regarding policies, programmes, and projects in different emerging countries. An understanding of the changing nature of emerging markets and the associated opportunities for your organisation. The ability to engage with a network of diverse professionals from around the world. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Inequalities in developing countries are at a 30-year peak and climbing due to the COVID-19 pandemic.1 These and other global struggles — such as the climate crisis and political polarisation — have led to worldwide consensus for a more inclusive and sustainable development model that promotes high living standards for all. As a result, there’s a wealth of opportunity for accelerated growth in emerging markets. But to drive lasting progress, leaders and practitioners in the public, private, and social sectors require a holistic understanding of the complex and vast factors that determine the development of the Global South.

Emerging markets are diverse and therefore defy a uniform narrative. This is why the Economic and Political Development in Developing Countries online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) takes a socioeconomic and political approach to various issues relevant to growth. Guided by esteemed faculty from LSE’s Department of International Development, you’ll leverage unique insights and real-world case studies to make more informed decisions about policies and projects in the emerging markets. By the end of this impactful six-week course, you’ll gain a practical toolkit to improve governance, make private and public organizations more effective, solve collective action issues, and increase accountability across the board.

1 OECD (Nd.) Accessed 23 February 2022.


This course will appeal to practitioners in the public, private, and social sectors with an interest in promoting equitable growth in emerging countries. It’s equally valuable to those working at the interface between emerging and advanced markets who would like a practical, holistic understanding of the development process. Guided by LSE faculty, the course is designed to inform decision-making regarding policies and projects in emerging markets. As a result, it will also benefit NGO employees, civil servants with investment imperatives, agency and bilateral agency staff, and private sector executives with existing operations or expansion opportunities in developing countries. Lastly, decision-makers at major multinational firms will critically engage with expert insights to enhance their business practices and inform financial decisions.

title: Internet of Things: Business Implications and Opportunities
primary_description: Build a business roadmap for successful tech integration.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A roadmap for the real-world implementation of IoT in your business. The ability to assess the state of leadership and technology integration in your company, and find opportunities to unite them for a strategic advantage. An understanding of the ways you can use IoT technologies on an organizational level to improve productivity.
tertiary_description:
The modern world is host to an enormous web of devices interconnected through sensors and networks — known as the Internet of Things (IoT). While IoT has already made its presence felt in the home through smart appliances, it represents a rich opportunity for business.

The Internet of Things: Business Implications and Opportunities online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management steps beyond the bounds of technical jargon to help you learn about the potential benefits and impact of IoT adoption on an organizational level. Through case studies, interactive media, and peer-to-peer learning, you’ll develop an understanding of the technologies and conditions necessary for successful integration of IoT in a business context. Ultimately, you'll gain the skills and knowledge to create a practical roadmap for the real-world implementation of IoT, and earn a digital certificate of completion from MIT Sloan.

This online program is ideal for managers and aspiring leaders looking to learn about the business opportunities that IoT can offer. Operations managers, entrepreneurs, and business analysts will benefit from understanding the impact and applications of IoT. Software engineers, data analysts, and IT engineers will learn to better communicate the benefits of IoT, while gaining methods for effective implementation.

title: Teaching With Technology
primary_description: Explore the practical applications of teaching with technology at every phase, from primary school to higher education.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Enhanced educational skills needed to adapt to new teaching approaches that enhance learning experiences for students. In-depth knowledge of how technology has evolved the teaching and training landscape. The ability to create pedagogically sound, practical lesson plans for various education phases. A comprehensive understanding of the pedagogical and practical implications of technology use in teaching and instruction. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As a result of accelerated global change, the integration of technology and education has become increasingly widespread. To excel in a modern classroom setting and the fast-evolving pedagogical landscape, educators need to adapt to new teaching and learning approaches to provide their students with an enhanced experience.

Discover how to incorporate technology into your classroom activities, lesson plans, and teaching strategies on the Teaching With Technology online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). Guided by industry expert and associate professor Joanne Hardman, you’ll discover the history of technology as a teaching aid and develop the ability to initiate a pedagogical transformation using technology in your environment.

Explore highly practical and theoretical applications as you gain the tools you need to deliver excellent education to your students at every educational phase. Apply these learnings, not only in times of disruption, but throughout your career.

The course is aimed at educators who are looking to improve their teaching skills and enhance the quality of the education they provide. Teachers and trainers interested in deploying technology and new pedagogical techniques into their teaching style will benefit from gaining the tools to build practical lesson plans and strategies. The flexible format of weekly modules and deadlines allows educators the opportunity to update their competencies around a busy schedule.

title: Sustainability Communication Strategies
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Develop practical tools and approaches to help navigate the complexities, challenges, and opportunities involved in communicating about sustainability.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Insight into the factors that influence organisational messaging around sustainability, including the changing social, political, economic, and media landscapes. The ability to understand audience attitudes, values, and beliefs in order to frame sustainability messaging and communicate with your audience as conversation partners. An approach to sustainability communication that balances ethics, organisational reputation, and stakeholder interests; and the skills to use the TADD (Trust, Access, Dialogue, and Disclosure) model to analyse context and frame sustainability messaging for maximum impact. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 3 weeks

As we face growing environmental and social challenges, companies around the world are seeking better and more sustainable ways of operating. But to drive meaningful change, they also need to rethink the way they communicate about their sustainability mission to employees, stakeholders, consumers, and the public. Today, professionals are tasked with developing open and honest communication strategies that reflect their organisation's efforts and speak to their audiences' attitudes, values, and beliefs about sustainability, while still delivering on business objectives.

The Sustainability Communication Strategies three-week online course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) will provide you with the tools to navigate the complexities and opportunities involved in impactful sustainability communication. Exploring both theory and practice, you’ll engage with current research, expert insights, and real-world case studies. You’ll learn how to develop an effective sustainability communications strategy that engages your audience as a conversation partner, balances ethics, organisational reputation, and stakeholder interests, and links communication with action.

This course is for professionals and mid-level managers who work in communications-related roles, seeking practical tools and techniques for developing internal and external messaging about sustainability initiatives and challenges. This includes those who are responsible for shareholder and stakeholder relations, community engagement, or public relations, as well as marketing communication professionals such as social media and brand managers. It would also benefit any manager who is in a public-facing function and needs to respond to consumer queries and concerns.

title: Digital Transformation Strategy
primary_description: Revamp your organization's approach to digital transformation and spearhead measurable, value-oriented strategies for innovation.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the potential of digital technologies to generate value and promote organizational growth. A holistic digital transformation approach that explores how each business function can advance to meet shifting customer behaviors. Practical insights into implementing a digital transformation strategy drawn from real-world case studies, and the skills to measure your strategy against business objectives. An enhanced perspective on digital transformation, and access to the exclusive Yale School of Management Executive Education group on LinkedIn upon successful completion of your program. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration : 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

The concept of digital transformation as a critical component of business success is not new; however, its adoption has become increasingly urgent. With nimble startups leveraging advancements in digital technology, established industries are compelled to keep up to stay competitive. But, merely adopting the latest technology is not enough to compete on the digital front. Organizations that attempt digital transformation without a shared vision often fail to achieve their goals. To develop the confidence to invest in digital transformation strategies and capabilities that facilitate continuous performance, one needs a comprehensive understanding of effective digital transformation.

The Yale School of Management Executive Education offers the Digital Transformation Strategy online program to equip individuals with the skills to drive transformation. This digital transformation strategy program spans six weeks and delves into strategic development, implementation, and change management needs for effective transformation. Participants gain an in-depth understanding of how digitalization adds value across all business functions, using global case studies to illustrate how digital technologies transform workforce requirements, customer relationships, and business value. The program adopts a holistic approach to achieving new modes of operation, focusing on the potential opportunities that digital transformation offers under the guidance of leading Yale SOM faculty.

The program is specifically designed to equip senior and business leaders with the necessary skills and frameworks to lead a successful digital strategy and stay competitive in the market. It focuses on preparing them for technological disruption and adapting internal processes to align with industry trends, workforce requirements, and customer needs. The program is also beneficial for mid-level and technical managers and specialists, who will understand the real-world applications of new technologies and how to bridge the gap between technical insight and business outcomes. With a holistic approach, the program is relevant to diverse industries and job functions where digital transformation is crucial to staying ahead.

title: Sales Management Program
primary_description: Lead your sales team and enhance business development for your organization.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:The ability to reach your organization’s targets while leading a team through market fluctuations and a complex business environment. The confidence to identify and solve complex issues within your organization’s sales function and team. The expertise to set targets, evaluate performance, provide impactful feedback, as well as a tool kit for managing rewards and compensation more transparently and efficiently. The skills to lead the digital transformation of sales organizations. The experience and insights from networking with like-minded international professionals from a wide range of industries, and unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The role of sales within an organization has grown increasingly strategic and customer-centric. As more customers choose to conduct their research and purchasing journey online and via social media, sales professionals must rethink their approach to strategic engagement. The sales force requires updated skills and tools to better support and guide the informed buyer from their initial interest to the post-purchase experience. To do this effectively, sales teams require analytical and strategy-focused leaders to guide their operations and drive performance.

The Sales Management Program from SDA Bocconi School of Management aims to equip you with the ability to lead your team through a shifting landscape. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll learn how to action change management, digital transformation and performance management within your organization. You’ll develop the skills to run a customer portfolio analysis and evaluate the various strategies and approaches to building customer relationships. You’ll gain frameworks to assess team performance, provide feedback, and design a compensation plan. Grow your knowledge and confidence as you explore conceptual models, real-world examples, and decision-support tools while reflecting on your progress through journaling and in the online forums. The curriculum also includes optional live sessions where you can network with peers and engage with program faculty and educators.

Participants who successfully earn a digital certificate of completion for the SDA Bocconi Sales Management Program may apply to enroll for the Executive Master in Marketing and Sales. The Sales Management Program certificate will count toward a segment of the Executive Master. Upon successful admission to the Executive Master, participants will be entitled to receive a discount of €3,000.

Note: Application to the Executive Master in Marketing and Sales is required, and the Executive Master assessments remain mandatory.

This program is for anyone looking to strategically manage sales in order to outsmart competitors, maintain or grow market share, and reach ever-increasing targets. This includes sales managers who are used to working individually but want to gain the skills to lead a team, as well as technical professionals who have moved into sales but lack managerial experience. The program would be particularly beneficial to sales managers in charge of a large team. They’ll learn how to improve their performance in their current position by taking a more strategic view of their function and role within the broader business. It is also useful to newly promoted sales managers, aspiring sales professionals, and those ready to move to the next stage of their careers.

title: Regulation Strategy
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Gain the insights to understand and effectively navigate regulation in your industry and beyond.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A contextualised understanding of regulation and compliance. The ability to critically assess the changing regulatory environment and how it affects you and your industry. Knowledge of the opportunities, challenges, and regulatory strategies applicable to your organisation. The skills to perform risk management and identify risks which influence your organisation's compliance. An understanding of the theory behind regulation, informed by expertise from LSE Law School.
tertiary_description:
Regulation can have a significant impact on the way organizations function, which is why decision makers must have a sound understanding of the evolving regulatory environment and the role it plays in their industries.

The Regulation Strategy online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) is designed to provide regulators and those in regulated industries with a firm grounding in the key features and processes of regulatory strategy. It offers the tools to help you think critically about how regulation should be designed and evaluated.

With this LSE online certificate course, you’ll learn to identify risks affecting regulatory compliance and explore how to perform risk management. Over eight weeks, you’ll consider law and policy regulation from a practical and multidisciplinary perspective, drawing on expertise from LSE Law School. This course uses cross-sectoral and cross-national examples, giving learners from various backgrounds the opportunity to gain highly transferable skills and remain up to date in an increasingly dynamic field.

This course is of value to business professionals impacted by regulation, whether in risk, legal, or compliance departments. Business leaders at the helm of companies subject to significant law and policy regulations will also benefit from the course.

If you’re an entrepreneur beginning a new venture or a consultant with a client portfolio subject to regulation, the course will provide you with a firm foundation for managing a regulatory strategy.

The course is also relevant if you’re an employee working within a regulatory organization who wants to validate or enhance your skill set. If you’re a public policy professional in a non-governmental or non-profit organization, a government employee, or if you’re working in a regulatory agency in a government department tasked with risk management, you’ll find this course invaluable.

title: Strategic Project Management
primary_description: Enhance your ability to apply strategic principles to project management.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to move beyond basic project management by applying strategic principles to effectively and successfully lead projects. The knowledge to evaluate and select viable projects that are strategically aligned to business objectives. Practical tools to conduct project risk assessments, facilitate change management, and lead teams in a virtual environment. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The need for strategic project management experience in business has grown, with organizations now requiring an increase in efficiency and agility to gain a competitive advantage. Traditionally, project management focuses on the application of tactics, but to overcome the complexities of a dynamic business environment, a defined strategy to make these tactics more effective is required.

The Strategic Project Management online short course from Rice University’s Susanne M. Glasscock School of Continuing Studies goes beyond traditional project management and equips you with the strategic techniques, skills, and tools to successfully achieve organizational and project-related goals. Over the course of eight weeks, you’ll learn to apply strategic thinking by aligning project, program, or portfolio goals to an organization's strategic plans. You’ll also gain the ability to lead and manage project teams in an agile manner. Throughout the course you’ll familiarize yourselves with a tool kit of strategic project management resources that you can use after you’ve completed the course.

This course is geared toward project management professionals looking to validate and expand their strategic expertise. Senior executives and managers involved in strategic decisions and functional specialists in operational roles will benefit from completing this course, as will those who need to drive strategic project management through execution. The course is also suited for business unit heads who want to transition from an operational to a more strategic role.

title: Employee Wellness and Stress Management
primary_description: Optimize your productivity and engagement at work with a mental and emotional toolkit to empower you to prioritize and support the wellbeing of self and others.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An action plan to improve and sustain resilience and well-being, including strategies to maintain energy, overcome bias, and promote a sense of community among team members. An understanding of the key techniques that balance professional productivity and personal health, such as sleep, good nutrition, and exercise. The mental and emotional tools to improve wellness and foster a team culture through psychological safety. Leadership strategies to identify and prevent burnout, and promote self and team well-being. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The consequences of stress are becoming increasingly apparent – not just to the individual, but to organizations as a whole. As the interdependent relationship between personal wellbeing and team productivity is realized, businesses are beginning to prioritize wellness for the resilience and benefits it brings.

The Employee Wellness and Stress Management online short course focuses on the impact you can have when you take the steps to improve your own, as well as others, health. Developed by Dr. Grace Gengoux from the Stanford Center for Health Education, you’ll gain strategies to support the self-care of the teams you lead and colleagues you influence, while also focusing on your own wellbeing and personal resilience. With this dual approach, you’ll explore the reciprocal relationship between a ‘healthy you’ and ‘healthy teams’ as you unpack the science and practical examples of self-care. With an understanding of how essential physical health practices are for stress and energy management, you’ll gain the tools and techniques to encourage wellbeing of self and others. The course uses self-reflection, goal setting, and global case studies to guide you as you define your wellness priorities, and build resilience for a fast-paced and complex working world.

This course is suited to individual employees who are invested in their personal wellbeing, and who need the tools to manage stress and enhance resilience in others. Professionals who include consultants, team leaders, and HR managers will benefit from learning to support employee wellbeing, identify signs of stress and burnout, and navigate mental health issues in the workplace. With the tools to cultivate wellness, people managers will get the chance to improve their leadership skills while optimizing their own, as well as their team’s, health. The course is also designed for dedicated healthcare and wellness professionals who need to improve their professional offering and better understand the dynamic between stress and well-being.

title: Human-Computer Interaction for User Experience Design
primary_description: Inform your user experience design with cutting-edge HCI concepts.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to integrate HCI thinking into your own work, building on your current knowledge of user experience (UX) to explore new possibilities. Access to the forward-thinking research of eight industry experts that is changing the face of human-computer interaction. The ability to better understand speech and vision tools through examples like eye-tracking and gaze-following technologies. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Human-Computer Interaction (HCI) has evolved extensively over time. Along with advancements in technology, HCI has the potential to transform our experience with machines by creating simpler, more powerful, and intuitive digital experiences.

The Human-Computer Interaction for User Experience Design online short course from the MIT Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (CSAIL) helps you reflect on the current state of user and computer interaction. Eight experts from MIT CSAIL have dedicated their research efforts to exploring the ways in which HCI can be enhanced, and they’re opening that research up to you through this online course so you can apply it for improved user experience (UX) and user interface (UI) design.

Guided by their industry insight, you’ll have the opportunity to imagine the future of HCI by reflecting on non-traditional interaction, speech recognition, and rapid prototyping, among others. Over the course of six weeks online, you’ll examine real-world applications of technology aimed at bettering UX and UI design, as you take your understanding beyond interface by integrating future-focused HCI into your work.

This program is designed to equip those who are interested in understanding the latest HCI research as part of their professional education, or are looking to explore a new career in human-computer interaction. Industry UX designers also stand to benefit by exploring HCI thinking and real-world applications, empowering them to conceptualize better interface designs.

title: Real Estate Development: Planning and Process
primary_description: Explore the complex public regulatory processes that underpin and control private real estate development.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the relationship dynamics between the public and private sectors in real estate development and planning. Knowledge of how the public sector uses zoning regulations to shape cities and manage private real estate development and land use. An overview of the advantages and disadvantages of public-private partnerships in real estate development. The skills to participate in the real estate development process and apply what you’ve learned to your local context. Unlimited access to edX's Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As the real estate industry becomes increasingly complex, both the public and private sectors require an in-depth understanding of the real estate development process. By developing a nuanced overview of public-private stakeholder interaction, professionals will be able to navigate the process more effectively and create value for all parties involved.

Gain insight into the real estate development process through a North American lens and explore the private-public stakeholder dynamic in the Real Estate Development: Planning and Process online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P). Through the use of real-world case studies, you’ll delve into the complexities of city planning and the urban development process and explore how various stakeholders interact, compete, and negotiate.

Over six weeks, you’ll also learn how innovative public-private partnerships can create new and diverse opportunities in real estate development and assist in the transformation of cities. Guided by Professor Kairos Shen’s extensive professional and academic experience, you’ll gain the knowledge and skills to approach the public sector, and apply the concepts learned to your local context.

This course is designed for professionals within the public and private real estate sectors. Public sector stakeholders will develop the insight to reform and innovate within the standard zoning regimen. Private real estate developers will gain the knowledge and confidence to approach regulators with transformative ideas and proposals that benefit local communities. Investment professionals who understand the need for public-private partnerships within real estate will benefit from an understanding of how this relationship could affect predictions and developments within the industry.

title: Public Relations (PR)
primary_description: Become an effective communications professional in the digital age.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The confidence to build strong public relationships and strategic communication plans. The ability to tactically manage a brand, business, or individual’s reputation among key stakeholders. An understanding of customer expectations and how to plan for crisis management. The tools to create messages that resonate across channels to control audience perception and drive influence. A road map for building influential relationships with stakeholders and the media.
tertiary_description:
The evolution of social and online media channels has caused a visible shift in the way we consume traditional media. As the communications landscape continues to change, businesses and brands must turn to public relations (PR) professionals to help control their public image in order to positively impact their bottom line.

Want to be recognized as a tactical and pre-emptive PR manager? The Public Relations online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) offers the perfect opportunity to enhance or launch your career in PR, by exploring the latest techniques and tactics for effective PR practice in a digital age. Over ten weeks, you’ll learn to create your own PR plan, and gain the confidence to build strong public relationships and communication strategies.

If you’re a new or aspiring PR practitioner looking to update your current skill set and enhance your career, this course will provide you with insights to help you grow in your field. Additionally, the course offers those wanting to break into the PR industry with foundational knowledge, practical skills, and validation from Africa’s leading university in the form of a certificate of completion.1

As the communications landscape continues to change, businesses and brands must turn to public relations (PR) professionals to help control their public image in order to positively impact their bottom line.

Want to be recognized as a tactical and pre-emptive PR manager? The Public Relations online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) offers the perfect opportunity to enhance or launch your career in PR, by exploring the latest techniques and tactics for effective PR practice in a digital age. Over ten weeks, you’ll learn to create your own PR plan, and gain the confidence to build strong public relationships and communication strategies.

If you’re a new or aspiring PR practitioner looking to update your current skill set and enhance your career, this course will provide you with insights to help you grow in your field. Additionally, the course offers those wanting to break into the PR industry with foundational knowledge, practical skills, and validation from Africa’s leading university in the form of a certificate of completion.1

1 QS Top Universities (2023).

title: Managing Technical Professionals
primary_description: Tailor your leadership style to develop and support the unique needs of your technical team.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of different management approaches that meet the unique requirements and expectations of technical professionals and teams. The insight to manage conflict within technical teams and improve communication, innovation, and performance. Critical insights to lead and motivate technical teams through effective communication, and manage diversity, risk, and change. Validation of your ability to lead technical teams with a certificate of completion from Africa’s leading university. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Running a technical team offers a unique set of management challenges. The demands, needs, and motivators held by technical staff are often underestimated in companies, resulting in high staff turnover. Furthermore, technical professionals are commonly encouraged to develop their technical skills at the expense of leadership and interpersonal skills. In order to retain these technical employees and ensure they are performing optimally, leadership approaches need to be tailored for a team’s effective development and growth.

Enhance your leadership and soft skills on the Technical Team Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT). Over eight weeks online, you’ll explore techniques that can be leveraged to improve team performance and innovation, and enhance career development opportunities for you and your direct reports. You’ll discover how to improve team dynamics, and manage change by cultivating effective communication channels, and strategic thinking. The course culminates in a team-specific and personal strategic action plan to help achieve organizational objectives.

This course aims to give existing or aspiring managers the ability to lead, support, and develop a team of technical employees, enhance their leadership skills and, by default, their careers. Due to its wide industry applicability, it can be relevant and beneficial to multiple technically orientated roles and responsibilities, including, but not limited to, IT experts, developers, engineers, and data scientists. Although the areas of expertise are varied and diverse, the course addresses leadership and development needs that are common across differing management positions in an effort to upskill technical professionals for an increasingly complex and demanding workforce.

title: Cost and Management Accounting
primary_description: Learn how to apply costing techniques and generate financial insights to inform key business decisions.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to estimate and report on business costs, and compile reliable budgets for products. An understanding of how to cut costs to maximise profits. The skills to analyse financial information and apply insights to set goals and improve resource management. Sound cost management knowledge you can draw on to make critical business decisions. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In a highly competitive corporate environment, more managers and business owners are seeking to streamline processes and optimize the use of resources. Those working in cost and management accounting roles are responsible for providing information that can guide economical decision-making, and play an important part in maximizing profit by controlling financial wastage.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Cost and Management Accounting online short course introduces you to the core principles of this function and covers a range of central concepts, such as job costing, process costing, absorption costing, and variable costing. You’ll discover how to use costings to make informed management decisions, and learn to perform a cost-volume-profit (CVP) analysis and manage funds through budgets.

This course is designed for finance and accounting professionals looking to refresh their knowledge and gain specific skills in the field of cost and management accounting. It’s also aimed at managers who want to improve their ability to make sound decisions based on financial insights, and business owners and entrepreneurs who need knowledge of costing techniques and systems.

title: Change Management
primary_description: Learn to plan, implement, and drive sustainable change within your organization.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A comprehensive change-management plan to implement within your organisation. The ability to identify a case for change and articulate the case to stakeholders. Knowledge of the change cycle, from planning to implementing and embedding change within an organisation. Change strategies, communication and conflict management skills, and the ability to evaluate an organisation’s state of change. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
With change being the only constant, businesses find themselves either becoming the drivers of that change or being driven by it. Learning to manage and adapt in a conscious, ethical, and sustainable way will be the differentiating factor among professionals and organizations in the future.

The Change Management online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) equips you with a comprehensive toolkit for solution design in the form of sustainable change management. This eight-week course offers a theoretical and practical focus that ensures change becomes embedded at every level in your organization. You’ll be exposed to a number of industry change management models, diagnostic tools, and real-world case studies. By the end of this course, you’ll walk away with the skills to successfully anticipate, articulate, and act with the goal of building your organization’s competency for change.

This course is ideal for professionals responsible for leading and implementing change in their organization or team. Those within a managerial role will gain practical strategies for driving change and aligning an organization’s culture and people towards adaptability. The models and tools taught can be applied to various contexts, businesses, and industries, ensuring a structured and planned approach to renewing an organization’s systems, infrastructure and operations. Professionals committed to their career development will be able to validate their experience and skills with a certificate from Africa’s leading university.1

1 QS Top Universities (Jun, 2020).

title: Blockchain and Digital Currency: The Future of Money
primary_description: Gain an in-depth understanding of crypto assets and harness the potential they offer.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of how blockchain technology fits into the existing financial systems, and how applications such as Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other crypto assets can be used. Insight into crypto assets and digital currencies in the South African and emerging market context. Knowledge of CBDCs that will help you stay abreast of the latest developments that are shaping the future of finance. An understanding of the ethical considerations that are associated with the rise of the crypto asset industry. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
It’s no longer enough to simply know about cryptocurrencies. With crypto assets and blockchain technologies growing at unprecedented rates, professionals need the ability to analyze and understand how the latest developments in the finance industry will fundamentally change the way the financial system functions in the present and near-future. Organizations that adapt their offerings to either compete with cryptocurrencies or offer services that support the industry are best positioned to take advantage of the rise of crypto assets.

The Blockchain and Digital Currency: The Future of Money online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) provides you with a deeper understanding of how blockchain works — and exists — within the current and future financial system. Over six weeks, you’ll explore the growing field of central bank digital currencies (CBDCs) and discover how they are influencing the future of the financial industry through an emerging market perspective. You’ll also investigate the ethical implications of investing in the crypto asset industry, and discover how ethics and governance can shape new financial infrastructure for the benefit of society.

On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with the enhanced skills and up-to-date industry knowledge of blockchain and cryptocurrencies needed to take advantage of the opportunities it creates.

This course is designed for anyone with an interest in new forms of money, particularly those involved in the financial industry, governments, central banks, and individuals involved in crypto assets in their personal capacity. Those who want to expand their working knowledge of blockchain and crypto assets to augment their role will also benefit. Professionals who already understand blockchain and digital currencies will walk away with future-focused skills that can be immediately applied within their role or business context. This course is broken up into weekly modules with incremental deadlines created to allow working professionals improve their skills without compromising on work and family responsibilities.
