title: Cybersecurity Risk and Strategy
primary_description: Acquire the frameworks and terminology required to make informed strategic decisions that enhance the overall cyber resilience of your organization from top to bottom.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:Insight into the new cybersecurity landscape, and threats that pose the most risk to your industry or organization. A cybersecurity strategy designed for your organization’s assets and risks that boost business value. An understanding of existing data protection regulations, and the ability to assess your organization’s cybersecurity governance strategy and preparedness for potential breaches. A practical approach to effective cybersecurity incident response planning and best practices for managing an incident. The knowledge to assess how well prepared your organization is for the short-term future by understanding the evolving trends in cybersecurity.
tertiary_description:
As the digital environment expands, methods behind cyberattacks become increasingly sophisticated, and the threats themselves take on new forms. Consumers are exceedingly conscientious about the protection of their shared data. And leading companies are learning that preserving trust is integral to customer experience, and a potent tool for strengthening their competitive advantage. In fact, many outperforming organizations distinguish themselves by sharpening their operational and strategic efforts in one specific area: cybersecurity.1

The Institute for Management Development (IMD) Cybersecurity Risk and Strategy online program takes a practical, non-technical approach to help you understand and navigate the evolving cybersecurity landscape. Over five weeks, you’ll gain the tools to effectively leverage current data protection regulations and build on the security systems you already have in place. Guided by industry experts, you’ll explore the future of cybersecurity in relation to the mainstream adoption of artificial intelligence (AI) and the internet of things (IoT). Finally, you’ll evaluate whether your organization is prepared for what's to come and develop an action plan to identify, prepare for, and respond to various cyberthreats.

1 _IBM (2021).
_

This program expands on basic cybersecurity concepts and practices to explore senior-level planning and decision-making. As a result, it’s ideally suited to those who have an interest in the connection between business value and cybersecurity management, whether they have technical experience or not. Business leaders who are tasked with promoting greater security awareness, or non-technical executives who recognize the importance of prioritizing security, will gain insight into the operational realities of cybersecurity implementation strategies. Additionally, people in management positions will learn to motivate for the adoption of better cybersecurity strategies in their organizations.

title: Management Analytics: Decision-Making Lessons From the Sports Industry
primary_description: Learn to use data and analytics to improve decision making within your organization.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A framework that offers a step-by-step plan for integrating data analytics into your organization. Key management and leadership skills to effectively execute data-driven strategies that align with your business objectives. Insights from the sports industry on how data can be used at an organizational level to improve strategic decision making.
tertiary_description:
As the amount of data in the world grows, so does the demand for skilled executives who are equipped with the knowledge to lead a data-driven organization. This program aims to teach managers and executives the strategic, technical, and managerial skills to integrate data analytics into an organization. Drawing on case studies from the sports industry, which has led the way in performance analytics, you’ll learn how to use data in your organization for improved decision making, goal setting, selection of appropriate technologies, structuring of teams, and communication. Guided by MIT faculty and industry thought leaders, this program helps you navigate the process of data transformation in your business or organization, from concept to implementation.

This MIT Sloan course aims to guide you to lead a data-driven transformation in your company. With an emphasis on process, management, and innovation, this program is designed to help business owners, leaders, and aspiring analysts understand the core elements of data analytics from a business perspective and harness it to gain a competitive edge. No technical experience is required.

title: Fintech: Disruption in Finance
primary_description: Equip yourself for the future of finance with an understanding of today’s most important fintech innovations, and learn to fund your own disruptive business idea.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A comprehensive understanding of the fintech industry and the new business opportunities it presents. Insight into the impact of blockchain technology, big data, and AI on financial services, particularly in the African context. A business plan for a fintech start-up and a strategy for how to fund it, guided by the thought-leadership of industry experts. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
As a result of inaccessible banking services, a large small-to-medium business sector, and growing populations, emerging markets have begun to find new solutions to long-standing financial pain points.* Fintech has risen to the challenge and aims to address, disrupt, and innovate the current financial landscape.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Fintech: Disruption in Finance online short course prepares you to better understand, interpret, and respond to the disruptions and opportunities within the financial market. With a holistic approach to the financial industry, this course provides you with an overview of the main fields of technological disruption, such as blockchain, artificial intelligence (AI), and big data. You’ll develop the ability to identify financial problems and apply fintech solutions within the context of emerging markets. The course will enable you to refine your disruptive business ideas and develop a funding strategy to get your fintech start-up off the ground. You’ll walk away with the knowledge and skills to make more strategic business decisions, unlock new career opportunities, and prepare for fintech innovation within your organisation and beyond.

  • McKinsey (Sep, 2020).

This course is aimed at financial professionals and graduates looking to unlock new career opportunities, embrace innovation in their current roles, and remain relevant in an industry that is being increasingly changed and driven forward by fintech. The content is aimed at students who want to take their business idea to the next level. It’s also suited to business decision makers who are eager to prepare for the future and make more informed strategic choices. No prior knowledge of fintech is required.

title: Rotman Women in Leadership
primary_description: Overcome the internalized barriers to your success as a woman in the workplace and embark on a journey of reflection.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:The skills and resilience to address and overcome internalized, structural barriers to work fulfillment and success. An elevated leadership presence that leverages emotional intelligence and non-verbal communication techniques. The ability to lead gender-inclusive teams and navigate difficult scenarios through effective conflict management. A leadership plan for your future that’s designed to achieve your personal goals and leadership vision. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Societal and cultural beliefs have long dictated a woman’s opportunities in the workplace. Although the conversation around women in leadership has increased in recent years, women continue to use male-normed management theories, and face unique challenges once in positions of power.

The purpose of the Rotman Women in Leadership online program is to reveal and address these systemic barriers and empower women within business. Developed by the Rotman School of Management at the University of Toronto, this six-week program delves into the historical and cultural constructs that have shaped belief systems of what it means to be a woman in the workplace. You’ll gain development tools and communication skills to overcome barriers to success, and be exposed to a global and diverse cohort of fellow women leaders.

The program analyzes the impact of gender stereotypes and focuses on building your leadership presence through non-verbal cues and emotional intelligence. You’ll learn to overcome inner obstacles such as imposter syndrome and understand how an inner dialogue is produced and harnessed. Upon completion of the program, you’ll have your own leadership plan, based on your personal goals and leadership vision.

This program is applicable to women across industries, in business and government. It holds particular value to women who are currently in leadership and management positions, but will also benefit those who aspire to move into these roles. Women executives and managers will gain the opportunity to elevate their leadership skills, presence, and effectiveness. Aspiring leaders will have the chance to develop their leadership skills and take the next step in their career journey. Women who are looking to empower other women will gain more insight into gender inclusivity and how it’s fostered in the workplace, and become more aware of internalized workplace challenges.

While the program is designed for those who identify as women and non-binary professionals, those who identify as male are welcome as well.

It holds particular value to women who are currently in leadership and management positions, but will also benefit those who aspire to move into these roles. Women executives and managers will gain the opportunity to elevate their leadership skills, presence, and effectiveness. Aspiring leaders will have the chance to develop their leadership skills and take the next step in their career journey. Women who are looking to empower other women will gain more insight into gender inclusivity and how it’s fostered in the workplace, and become more aware of internalized workplace challenges.

While the program is designed for those who identify as women and non-binary professionals, those who identify as male are welcome as well.

title: Real Estate Finance and Investment
primary_description: Deepen your knowledge of real estate investment to maximize returns and minimize mistakes.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of the most effective real estate valuation and financing techniques. A strategic tool kit to make more informed investment and financing decisions, mitigate risks, and circumvent major pitfalls. The ability to apply your knowledge to real-world contexts and to navigate your own investment journey with confidence. Validation of your skills and knowledge in the form of a certificate of completion from a globally recognized business school. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Despite the myriad market shocks of the past two decades, real estate has remained an in-demand and often lucrative investment option. However, many interested in the property market feel unequipped to navigate its challenges or seize its opportunities. To invest strategically, professionals need a solid foundation in the concepts, principles, and analytical methods involved in valuing and financing a property.

In the Real Estate Finance and Investment online program from Kellogg Executive Education at Northwestern University, you’ll unpack the key factors needed to make effective investment decisions. Over the course of six weeks, you’ll examine the process of acquiring a profit-generating property, including valuing it, financing it, and measuring the impact of the tax laws governing it. You’ll also learn how to actively forecast expected cash flow and avoid common investment mistakes and risks. Each module includes a practical, real-world case study — designed specifically by an industry expert to consolidate learnings — giving you the confidence to execute effective investment decisions by the program’s end.

This program is designed for any professionals interested in real estate investment who want to develop their knowledge of financing, valuation, and investing techniques. Chief among these are senior executives and investors operating in the real estate industry who are seeking to gain new insights, drive decision-making, and avoid common pitfalls. Real estate professionals such as advisers, analysts, consultants, and managers will also find value in the program’s exploration of key principles and analytical methods. All students will gain the practical skills and the confidence to accurately determine the potential return on a real estate investment, whether in their professional or personal capacity.

title: Data Science in Real Estate
primary_description: Gain the analytical tools to use data for informed decision making in real estate.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Tools to inform your real estate investments using insights from data analytics. An understanding of the various factors that impact the value of a property investment. The ability to perform statistical analyses and modeling using interactive software applications like R and Jupyter notebooks. Knowledge of the fundamentals of machine learning concepts in the context of the built environment. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Thanks to machine learning and data analytics, real estate professionals and investors can now make more accurate property assessments than ever before. This Data Science in Real Estate online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P) focuses on growing your data science skills within the context of the built environment. During the program, esteemed MIT faculty and industry experts will teach you how to harness statistical techniques to reveal key insights into the factors that impact property investment and development opportunities.

Over six weeks, you’ll learn how to evaluate and tidy data, expand data sets, and generate a selection of models that can be used to explain industry trends and forecast real estate values.

This MIT SA+P program provides learners with the data science skills to support decision making and grow a successful property portfolio. Those with experience in data analytics will benefit by learning to apply their skills to the real estate market, while real estate professionals and independent investors can increase their competitive edge by building data skills to improve analysis and valuation, helping them to make better decisions.

While there are no formal prerequisites for this course, it’s highly recommended that you have a basic understanding of programming, in particular using R. You should be familiar with different data types and basic data structures, including objects, functions, vectors, matrices, data frames, and factors; and have used them practically in the past. If you don’t yet have an understanding of these concepts, you can explore the bridging resources made available in the course brochure.

title: Blockchain and the Future of Finance
primary_description: Demystify blockchain technology, unpack its potential, and investigate its applications in the world of finance.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:Insight into the major players shaping fintech, and core strategies for responding to disruption. An understanding of how blockchain technology is changing the banking system, and a grasp of the regulations impacting open banking. An overview of the token economy, the functions of different tokens, and the impact of tokenization on finance. Knowledge of the benefits, limitations, and risks of DeFi, and the use of digital assets like NFTs and cryptocurrencies. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The advent of blockchain has spurred many innovations in the financial technology (fintech) space that are revolutionizing the world of finance. Businesses and financial institutions are being called to adapt or risk becoming obsolete. The challenge is, many professionals and company leaders still don’t fully understand what blockchain is and how it can be successfully applied in business contexts.

In the Blockchain and the Future of Finance online program from the Institute for Management Development (IMD), you’ll explore the current fintech landscape, debate where the sector is going, and unpack the various finance applications of blockchain technology. Over five weeks, you’ll draw on case studies and company examples to clarify complex concepts and better understand open banking strategies, the world of cryptocurrencies, and the way in which tokenization is creating new business models. Ultimately, you’ll leave with an understanding of the evolution of decentralized finance (DeFi), the potential of non-fungible tokens (NFTs), and the possibilities that the future holds for finance.

All professionals and individuals interested in understanding and responding to disruptions and opportunities in the financial sector will find value in this program. The content will be especially beneficial to business leaders and financial professionals who want to delve into money digitalization and capitalize on the potential of blockchain’s new and evolving applications. Similarly, technology professionals can unlock career opportunities by learning more about fintech innovations, and entrepreneurs can explore ways to leverage blockchain, tokenization, DeFi, and digital assets for profit. Relevant roles include C-suite executives, business development managers, investment bankers, financial consultants, traders, software engineers, and data scientists, among others.

title: Economics for Business
primary_description: Identify the economic forces shaping your business and make informed decisions that drive change.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Tools and frameworks to navigate the economic forces affecting your business. The ability to identify and evaluate macroeconomic variables, policies, and financial indicators, and account for these events in your decision making. A critical intuition for macroeconomic trends developed through problem-based learning and led by world-renowned economist Professor Roberto Rigobon.
tertiary_description:
Large-scale economic trends can profoundly affect businesses of all sizes, whether it’s inflation, governmental policy, or changes in market demand. For contemporary organizations to remain competitive, executives must account for the impact in their strategic decision making. The Economics for Business online program from MIT Sloan offers you the opportunity to explore economics from a business perspective, guided by renowned economist Professor Roberto Rigobon. You’ll be exposed to an engaging mix of case studies, narratives, and problem-solving activities designed to build your understanding of macroeconomics. On completion, you’ll be able to apply your knowledge to interpret and manage economic change within your organization.

The program is geared toward business professionals and leaders looking to understand the influence of economic trends on business and seeking tools, concepts, and models to inform their decision making. Aspiring managers and executives with decision-making responsibilities stand to benefit from an understanding of the broader business environment. The cross-industry applications of macroeconomics are beneficial for business professionals aiming to enhance their knowledge of economic trends and advance their careers.

title: Search Engine Optimisation
primary_description: Optimize your online presence with powerful SEO strategies.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Best practices to drive more traffic to your website and impact its online business presence. The ability to design paid content strategies for effective SEO. The skills to compile an SEO performance report based on analytics and data tools. Knowledge of the basic principles of HTML and site architecture. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Due to the rapid rise of digital technologies, new online and optimization strategies are required. As a modern professional or business owner, understanding how to harness the power of search engine optimization (SEO) to market your business is essential to supporting its online presence and ultimate success.

Ensure your business is as visible as possible in search engine results pages with the Search Engine Optimization online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT).

This course aims to equip you with the skills to implement your own SEO tactics and strategies, giving you a competitive market advantage. You’ll gain fundamental principles and practical skills to drive more traffic to websites through SEO-optimized content. By practicing on a live eCommerce Wordpress website, you’ll walk away with the ability to offer in-demand SEO services for clients, and boost your website’s ranking.

This course has been designed for both existing digital marketing professionals and those entering the field. Professionals within digital marketing will get the opportunity to refine and advance their skill set with the latest SEO practices, tools, and ethics. Professionals new to online marketing will gain a comprehensive understanding of the need for SEO, content strategies, website structures, and analytics tools. Business owners and entrepreneurs will also benefit from learning practical optimization strategies which they can immediately implement within their context. Marketers, web professionals, and those starting a career in SEO will have the opportunity to validate their skills with a digital certificate.

title: Sustainable Finance and Investment
primary_description: Gain a competitive advantage when you merge environmental, social, and governance factors into your financial and investment decisions.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:Tools, frameworks, and insights to make educated decisions for your sustainable financial and investment goals. A holistic understanding of the ESG ecosystem, data and metrics, and how this can be leveraged to inform your investment strategies. Industry knowledge from Yale SOM faculty and numerous guest experts, empowering you to drive sustainable finance in business. Unlimited access to 2U’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Environmental, social, and governance (ESG) issues continue to gain momentum. But achieving targets like a net zero economy and equality will need the support of financial services.1 What’s more, companies have realized that integrating ESG criteria into business decisions goes beyond simply being more sustainable — it’s profitable too.

The Sustainable Finance and Investment online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education examines the ESG ecosystem: the terminology, activity, drivers, and participants. With this industry road map, you’ll become equipped to understand the core of sustainable finance systems with the skills to accelerate this shift in business. You’ll examine the challenges and opportunities of ESG data within the context of investment decision-making; explore its integration in asset-pricing models, portfolio management, and investment products; and learn how it can be used to determine investment strategies. The program features real-time data, gamified investment role playing, and interviews with a multitude of industry experts, giving you the practical skills, insights, and metrics to drive sustainable financial performance and investment strategies in your organization or career.

1 EY (Jan, 2021).

This program has been designed for business leaders and professionals in strategic roles who are aiming to make more informed, sustainable investment decisions. It will be beneficial to individuals from a wide range of industries, including investment, asset management, and banking. They’ll gain the skills to accelerate the transformation towards sustainable finance in their organizations, and learn to better report on sustainable investment returns. Consultants working in sustainability and project execution, as well as public policy professionals, will similarly gain insight into the ESG data and metrics that help shape sustainable investments.

title: Real Estate Financial Analytics
primary_description: Learn how to leverage quantitative analytical techniques and financial modeling to inform real estate investment decisions and risk.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The skills to use quantitative techniques and financial modeling to understand real estate price dynamics. Insight into leveraging investment flexibility to manage and take advantage of uncertainty. The ability to interpret Monte Carlo simulation analysis to determine risk and return in real estate investment decisions. Statistical analysis techniques to inform real estate investment decision making, and the knowledge to assess the financial viability of residential and commercial investments. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Changing tenant expectations, sustainability concerns, and where people choose to live due to work-from-home protocols are reshaping the commercial and residential real estate markets. It requires data and quantitative analysis skills to predict the full impact of this on the property sector, and investment and development decisions.

The Real Estate Financial Analytics online short course from the MIT School of Architecture and Planning (MIT SA+P) will enable you to transform uncertainty (‘unknown unknowns’) into risk (‘known unknowns’). You’ll gain the technical skills and tools to assess the viability of residential and commercial real estate investments using rigorous analysis techniques, simulation modeling, and financial modeling. This six-week program introduces real estate price dynamics and teaches you to quantitatively model them using Microsoft Excel, in order to understand some of the challenges of real estate price indexing. It also explores the lure and limitations of forecasting and how to make more accurate predictions using Monte Carlo simulation.

In addition, you’ll explore how flexibility in the context of uncertainty can add value to investments, as well as assess the quantitative and qualitative value of real estate investment decision flexibility using simulation modeling. With guidance from MIT academics and industry experts, you’ll discover the potential for new financial engineering tools based on real estate price indexing.

This program is designed to help equip finance and built environment professionals with the knowledge and techniques to navigate real estate investment decisions successfully. Whether for personal investment management or in a professional capacity, this course aims to provide you with the skills and tools to make better recommendations and projections, identify high-return investments, and build an enduringly strong portfolio.

Business leaders, financial executives, real estate entrepreneurs, developers, and fund managers and advisers will build on their current skill set, and gain insight into the latest investment trends and structures. Analysts — especially those looking to hone in-demand, specialist real estate expertise — will benefit from the expert thought leadership in areas such as property price dynamics and valuation in the capital market. Due to the technical nature of this course, it’s best suited to those with existing knowledge of finance or economic analysis and experience using Microsoft Excel.

title: Social Media Strategy: Creating Engagement, Insight, and Action
primary_description: Gain an understanding of the science behind social media to optimize your social media strategy.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The tools to leverage social media to achieve strategic organizational objectives. An understanding of the economic and neurological underpinnings of social media. A playbook of tactics to enhance your marketing efforts in a hypersocialized world. Valuable insight from renowned social media authority Sinan Aral, as well as a host of influential industry experts.
tertiary_description:
As social media evolves, it provides organizations with new and exciting ways to share their message and engage their audiences. However, to drive real action, they need to understand the science behind social media and the key to harnessing it effectively for business success.

The Social Media Strategy: Creating Engagement, Insight, and Action online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management offers an in-depth look into the forces driving social media and how you can use them strategically to reach your organization’s goals.

Drawing on Sinan Aral’s book, The Hype Machine , you’ll gain an understanding of the technologies and trends impacting the social media landscape, as well as the neurological and economic factors that shape human behavior. Throughout this course, you’ll also learn about several powerful techniques to improve your social media marketing strategy. With guidance from MIT faculty and industry experts, you’ll walk away with the tools to leverage social media’s potential now and in the future.

The functional and strategic skills taught in this social media strategy course from MIT Sloan can be applied across any organization, both in the public or private sector. Business leaders and marketing professionals will all benefit from the various case studies featured throughout the program, as well as the practical frameworks for navigating today’s social media environment. It’s also relevant for NGOs, governments, policymakers, and influencers who wish to influence and engage their audience in an effective but ethical way.

With guidance from MIT faculty and industry experts, you’ll walk away with the tools to leverage social media’s potential now and in the future.

The functional and strategic skills taught in this social media strategy course from MIT Sloan can be applied across any organization, both in the public or private sector. Business leaders and marketing professionals will all benefit from the various case studies featured throughout the program, as well as the practical frameworks for navigating today’s social media environment. It’s also relevant for NGOs, governments, policymakers, and influencers who wish to influence and engage their audience in an effective but ethical way.

title: Digital Photography
primary_description: Learn how to capture and edit high-quality digital photographs for business or personal purposes
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An understanding of key photographic concepts, such as aperture, shutter speed, and ISO, and how they impact image quality. The ability to use light to your advantage, and the knowledge to construct appealing compositions. The skills to digitally edit photographs and apply a range of visual effects. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Images are a powerful way to immortalize moments and tell compelling stories. Whether you plan to draw on photography in a personal or professional capacity, these skills are a valuable addition to your repertoire of competencies.

The University of Cape Town (UCT) Digital Photography online short course introduces you to the features and functionalities of digital SLR cameras, and teaches you how to use different settings to take high-quality images under a range of conditions. You’ll also discover the principles of composition, and learn basic photo-editing techniques.

During the course, you’ll apply what you learn practically to produce a range of images, and you’ll benefit from ongoing constructive feedback from your head tutor, professional photographer Roberta Crumplin.

This course covers foundational digital photography terms and techniques. It’s therefore suited to both hobbyists and aspiring or self-taught photographers wanting to build or refine a practical skill set. Similarly, the content will appeal to professionals looking to develop digital photography skills for application in marketing, journalism, and other business contexts. In order to complete this course, students need access to their own digital SLR camera.

title: Leading the Future of Work
primary_description: Learn how to adapt your organization for the future by leveraging technology, implementing high-road strategies, and empowering your workforce.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A leadership toolkit, as well as insight into the challenges and opportunities of the future of work. The knowledge to strategically integrate technology into your organization. High-road business strategies to lead your organization into the future and empower your workforce. A practical understanding of the role companies, employees, government, and society play in shaping a new social contract.
tertiary_description:
The world has experienced a fundamental shift in the business landscape. Automation and Artificial Intelligence (AI) are at the forefront of this, acting as the catalysts of workplace change. However, technology and business AI are only part of the evolution.

The Leading the Future of Work online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management explores the various factors driving transformation and shaping the future of business design. It also highlights the role organizations, employees, government officials, and public policymakers must play in response to rapid change. At the heart of it lies the need for a new social contract — the mutual expectations and obligations workers, employers and their communities, and society have for work and employment relationships. By developing a high-road business strategy that benefits employees and shareholders alike, you’ll be better positioned to stay ahead of your competitors while leading your business forward into the future.

This program will appeal to anyone interested in the future of work technology and design, and how key changes will impact their career or organization. Business leaders and managers will gain the confidence to make decisions and implement strategies that lead their firms toward the future. Those working in the public sector — such as policymakers, government officials, or members of civic institutions — can use their new skills to influence labor and work development policies. Consultants or specialists in HR transformation, organizational design, business agility, and change management will gain the tools necessary to drive change in their respective organizations and workforces.

title: Copywriting for Digital Marketing
primary_description: Improve your ability to generate leads and drive conversion through impactful online copy.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to create engaging copy that inspires your target audience to take action. The skills to write marketing copy for different digital platforms and social media. The expertise to enhance google search rankings, generate more leads, and increase conversions. Validation of your copywriting ability, with an official digital certificate from UCT. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The success of an organization’s online marketing material can be significantly enhanced by the work of a skilled copywriter. It’s the copywriter’s job to create persuasive, engaging content that captures an audience and inspires them to take action, and the University of Cape Town (UCT) Copywriting for Digital Marketing online short course is designed to prepare you for this task.

Guided by an industry expert, you’ll learn to apply copywriting best practices and techniques, write compelling copy, headlines, and calls-to-action for various online platforms, and develop a content marketing plan. You’ll also discover more about how copy can be changed to enhance search engine optimization and how to price copywriting work.

Equipped with the tools to tackle writing in the dynamic digital landscape, you’ll have the foundation to become an invaluable asset to any company that needs to distinguish their brand or business online.

This course is suitable for aspiring copywriters looking to gain practical and up-to-date skills to move into a new role. It will also benefit existing copywriters who want to refresh their knowledge and stay abreast of the skills needed in a constantly evolving industry. The content is also relevant to business owners or entrepreneurs looking to improve the effectiveness of their digital marketing material.

title: Applied Data Analysis and Visualisation for Business
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Develop in-demand data visualisation and analysis skills to elevate your career in a data-driven world.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A powerful blend of practical skills to leverage data to investigate business decisions. Proficiency in Tableau and Microsoft Excel, preparing you to confidently work with these tools when you enter the workplace. The ability to critically evaluate your own work and that of others, as well as interpret, critique, and improve data visualisations and analysis outputs. Expertise in econometric and statistical modelling methods, such as multiple linear regression, forecasting, and Monte Carlo simulations. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Duration: 6 weeks (excluding orientation)

Effective data visualisation and storytelling has the power to transform complex data into impactful insights that guide informed decision-making. This crucial skill enables businesses to spot patterns, make strategic decisions, and predict future trends, helping them to build data-driven growth and success.

Unearth the power of data with the Applied Data Visualisation and Analysis for Business online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE). Over six weeks, you'll learn the art of converting raw data into captivating visual narratives using Tableau. You’ll also be armed with a suite of econometric and statistical modelling tools in Microsoft Excel. Guided by experts, you’ll gain a deep understanding of the technical details that support effective data visualisations and the expertise needed to thrive in a data-centric environment.

This course is intended for business professionals seeking to boost their technical data visualisation and analysis skill set and grow their ability to influence decision-makers through data storytelling. It's also appropriate for those wishing to enhance their mastery of data visualisation using Tableau and data modelling using Excel.

Those interested in the course should ideally be familiar with Tableau basics (the interface, connecting to datasets, and creating basic visualisations) and introductory statistical concepts. There will, however, be a light refresher on these concepts in the course material.

If you don’t have these skills yet, or feel you could benefit from a more-in depth refresher, the LSE Data Analysis for Management online certificate course can provide you with Tableau fundamentals.

This Applied Data Visualisation and Analysis for Business online certificate course is certified by the United Kingdom CPD Certification Service, and may be applicable to individuals who are members of, or are associated with, UK-based professional bodies. The course has an estimated 54 hours of learning.

Note: should you wish to claim CPD activity, the onus is on you. The London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE) and GetSmarter accept no responsibility, and cannot be held responsible, for the claiming or validation of hours or points.

title: Global Health Delivery
primary_description: Understand the challenges facing healthcare delivery, and design a solution for real-world implementation.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:An action plan to implement health interventions in your particular context. A biosocial framework to assess how biological and social factors influence the spread of disease. An understanding of the restrictions and challenges facing healthcare delivery. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The greatest challenge to effectively managing and improving healthcare delivery isn’t availability, but access. Join a global health community in this online short course from Harvard's Office of the Vice Provost for Advances in Learning (VPAL), in association with HarvardX, as you analyze the influence that power and social structures have in shaping disease response. Through real-world case studies, you’ll investigate international approaches to fighting Ebola, HIV/AIDS, and MDR-TB, and understand the burden of mental health. You’ll evaluate how ideologies, problem framing, and the choice of metrics shape health policy.

With guidance from expert university faculty, you’ll design your own global health intervention for actual implementation across public and private settings. Over the course of 10 weeks online, this program will also equip you with the managerial and soft skills to complement your medical knowledge, and you’ll ultimately leave with a premier certificate from Harvard’s VPAL, in association with HarvardX.

This online short course is for anyone with a passion for healthcare innovation who is looking for solutions to better serve their communities. This includes professional clinicians and public health practitioners as well as established global health leaders such as advisors, policymakers, and government officials. This program would also be relevant for investors and donors of global health initiatives, or those working in a multilateral organization, bilateral agency, NPO, or NGO.

title: Managing the Human Side of Digital Disruption
primary_description: Leverage a human-centered approach to effectively navigate digital change in your organization.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:Insight into how people and teams in your organization are affected by digital transformation. The ability to achieve a competitive advantage by taking a human-centric approach to digitally driven transformation. An in-depth understanding of the interactions between role adjustment, capabilities acquisition, and emotional energy to effectively support people through each dimension of the transition process. The tools to map your transformation journey and the skills to successfully lead your organization through digital change.
tertiary_description:
Due to continuous technological innovation and the move to remote work, organizations are facing increased pressure to digitize rapidly. To effectively lead a company through this digital transformation, business leaders need to upskill and learn how to control the psychological impact change and transition can have on their employees and teams.

Gain the tools to help navigate digital change from the human perspective in the Managing the Human Side of Digital Disruption online short course from the MIT Sloan School of Management. Over six weeks, you’ll draw on Faculty Directors Hal Gregersen and Roger Lehman’s original Transition-Curve Framework to understand and manage the development of your team’s roles, capabilities, and emotional responses to change. You’ll also learn how to facilitate effective change at an individual, team, and organizational level through leveraging the superpowers of purpose and inquiry and establishing the essential conditions of psychological safety and trust. Finally, you’ll apply the program content to predict change, learn from it, and confidently and successfully lead current and future transformations.

This course provides managers and business leaders with the skills and tools to help their people and teams through digital change by improving employee experience and engagement. Similarly, the program applies to business leaders looking to analyze digital change's impact on organizational models and implement solutions. This course will also benefit business advisers and consultants who require enhanced digital transformation leadership knowledge and skills to set themselves apart. In addition, HR business partners who aim to improve employee value propositions and experiences in an evolving business landscape will find the concepts covered useful.

title: Decision Making
primary_description: Make more effective choices in both business and your personal life with an understanding of the drivers behind decision making.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to make more effective decisions both personally and professionally. An understanding of how and why decisions are made, by you and by others. The knowledge to analyze decisions and avoid common decision-making pitfalls. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In an increasingly complex world, the decisions we make have a profound impact on our successes, both personally and professionally, and can influence the direction of our lives, careers, organizations, and even societies.

The Decision Making online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education gives you the knowledge and skills needed to make effective decisions across any context. Guided by expert faculty, you’ll develop an understanding of the psychological and behavioral drivers, biases, rules, and heuristics that form the foundation of how decisions are made. You’ll also explore the core pillars of decision making — context, uncertainty, and time — in order to better analyze your decisions and make more informed choices, no matter your situation.

This program is useful for anyone who wants to master the art of effective decision making. Senior leaders and decision makers who often have to solve problems in the face of uncertainty would benefit from the content, as would professionals across a variety of functions. This includes people in fast-paced industries such as marketing, finance, IT, and business development. Those looking for guidance on how to make better decisions in their everyday life will also find great value in this program.

title: Supply Chain Management: AI, Sustainability, and Resilience Strategies Program
primary_description: Enhance your ability to drive innovation in your organization by thoroughly investigating the impacts of new technologies and processes on the supply chain life cycle.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:Real-world tools and frameworks for reinventing your supply chain operations using AI and IoT technologies. Practical methods for building more resilient supply chains and navigating unforeseen disruption. An enhanced ability to create significant strategic value within your supply chain organization An updated leadership skill set, helping you confidently and effectively navigate supply chain transformation Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Supply chains are the lifeblood of many organizations. However, with changing consumer expectations and the emergence of disruptive technologies, traditional supply chain practices now fall short. Supply chain leaders must adopt strategic innovation if they want to navigate this shifting environment and gain a competitive edge.

The Leading Supply Chain Innovation Program from the Executive Education team at the Yale School of Management empowers you to facilitate this innovation. Over six weeks, the program delves into industry best practices, with an emphasis on seamlessly integrating cutting-edge technologies into supply chain operations. Centring on creating value through innovation, the program explores ways to leverage artificial intelligence (AI) and the Internet of Things (IoT) to reinvent your operations, build resilience, and construct responsible and sustainable supply chains. Additionally, it offers deep insights into the decision-making processes of real-world leaders tackling the complex task of transforming a supply chain organization. Rooted in practical case studies, the program equips you with immediately applicable insights to lead transformations throughout the supply chain life cycle.

This program is designed for existing or aspiring supply chain leaders with a solid understanding of the supply chain life cycle and a minimum of ten years of experience in essential functions such as warehousing, transportation, operations, and logistics.

If you’re a strategy-oriented professional motivated to advance your career by leading your supply chain organization's innovation and digitization, this program might be for you. It’s suitable for seasoned leaders in the supply chain, specialists in supply chain transformation, integrators of supply chain technology, planners in the supply chain, managers in operations or logistics, experts in change management, strategists focused on growth, and AI enthusiasts.

title: Public Sector Financial Reporting
primary_description: Gain an in-depth understanding of the specialized frameworks underpinning public sector financial reporting.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to work with a financial reporting team and implement processes to create annual public financial statements. A thorough comprehension of the differences between the GRAP framework, IFRS, and the modified cash basis relevant to public sector financial reporting. The skills to navigate and manage budget information, cash flow statements, accounting policies, and changes and errors. The accounting principles driving public sector imperatives and methods to accurately report on revenue, assets, liabilities, and working capital. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Rising concerns around global government spending has led to public demand for accurate and transparent financial reports, setting higher standards for treasury management. To meet these requirements, it’s imperative that professionals in this field use the Generally Recognised Accounting Practice (GRAP) frameworks that underpin financial reporting in the public sector. In doing so, they can create a credible record that communicates high-quality expenditure information, which informs policy and decision making, and in turn drives the better use of public resources.

The Public Sector Financial Reporting online short course from the University of Cape Town (UCT) is based on the Postgraduate Diploma in Public Sector Accounting offered by UCT. Part of this course has been developed into smaller online short courses that allow professionals to study specific areas of public sector structures, governance, accounting, and finance, in order to bolster their skills in this important and relevant field.

This online short course covers specialized and highly technical concepts to help you accurately recognize, measure, and report on current and non-current assets within the public finance sector. Over 12 weeks, you’ll gain expert tools and insights from UCT faculty, as you learn to draft in-depth financial statements for public sector entities.

This highly intensive course is aimed at private or public sector professionals looking to enable career growth in the public finance sector. It’s valuable to those who are starting their career and would like to prepare for a future role in public sector finance within South Africa, as well as other countries in Africa. Established balance sheet custodians, accounting consultants, and financial managers who are interested in formalizing and augmenting their knowledge within the specialized field of public sector accounting will also benefit from the tangible outcomes and analytical toolkit delivered throughout this 12-week course.

secondary_description.value: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:The ability to work with a financial reporting team and implement processes to create annual public financial statements. A thorough comprehension of the differences between the GRAP framework, IFRS, and the modified cash basis relevant to public sector financial reporting. The skills to navigate and manage budget information, cash flow statements, accounting policies, and changes and errors. The accounting principles driving public sector imperatives and methods to accurately report on revenue, assets, liabilities, and working capital. title: Leadership for Global Business and Politics
primary_description: Develop the knowledge and skills for effective leadership in a changing social, political, and environmental context.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:The ability to see beyond business and the market, with an enhanced understanding of stakeholder capitalism and the global social, political, and environmental landscape. Insights and tools to lead effectively through the pressures of future disruption. The skills to assess and improve engagement with key stakeholders internally and externally, and how differing global contexts influence these interactions. Strategic frameworks to affect and redefine your nonmarket environment, and factor these forces into your decision-making to strengthen your competitive advantage. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
Organizations operate within the context of their competitors, suppliers, and customers, but also within a broader nonmarket environment that includes social, political, environmental, and regulatory forces.

The Leadership for Global Business and Politics online program, from the Yale School of Management Executive Education, offers business leaders an evolved perspective of nonmarket factors that affect business. It provides strategies, language, frameworks, and tools to analyze and respond to these factors to gain a competitive advantage.

Guided by industry expert David Bach, you’ll develop the skills and knowledge to drive strategies that anticipate and plan for change and disruption. Explore the move toward stakeholder capitalism, how it relates to your organization, and how it can be leveraged for a sustainable, strategic edge. You’ll also gain the opportunity to engage with a diverse and international group of participants, and grow your global network online.

This online program will equip you with transnational leadership practices and the skills to assess the global and political economy. Led by experts on international affairs, you’ll learn how multinational organizations can balance the effects of globalization and maintain sound international relations. This program is designed for those working in strategy, communications, government affairs, corporate responsibility, business development, and leading industries, who need to be cognizant of topical social, political, and environmental issues. Executives who need to consider the impact of political and social issues on their business will be equipped with the terminology and a best practice approach to leadership in a rapidly changing corporate and societal landscape. Functional managers who are interested in pursuing a greater involvement in business strategy will benefit from access to frameworks and tools that will allow them to engage effectively with the impact of nonmarket forces on their organization, while managing stakeholder engagement in a global context.

title: Leadership Program
primary_description: Learn to adapt your leadership approach to the needs of your team and organization.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:A leadership decision-aid that you can use to guide your leadership approach. Practical leadership skills needed to motivate a team toward achieving business goals. The ability to apply personality theory to different leadership scenarios. Valuable insight from leadership experts, empowering you to overcome organizational challenges and drive team success. A digital certificate of completion from a highly ranked business school as formal validation of your leadership abilities.
tertiary_description:
Effective leaders know how to adapt to various situations and challenges within an organization. Whether your team is new, transitioning through change, or is under pressure to perform, choosing the correct leadership approach is vital.

The Leadership Program from the UC Davis Graduate School of Management (GSM) gives you the frameworks to do this. Guided by a situational theory of leadership, the program offers an experiential learning process whereby you’ll get the opportunity to lead a fictional team through a number of different scenarios while assessing your role within that environment.

The curriculum focuses on three key areas: the self as a leader, leadership as a relationship with your team, and the environment in which teams are situated. Through these lenses you’ll develop practical strategies to build trust, lead through times of change and crisis, and motivate your team to reach their objectives.

The UC Davis Graduate School of Management Leadership Program was recently ranked as one of the top leadership certificate courses in the U.S. by CIO.


This leadership program is designed for professionals who want to enhance their careers, as well as those who are aspiring to step into a management or leadership position. It would also be beneficial to established managers or team leads who are looking to take on more responsibility, further build their teams, or develop their individual leadership style. The situational decision-aid you’ll walk away with is a useful tool for anyone who wants to align their leadership approach with the needs of their team and organization.

title: Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program
primary_description: Integrate sustainability practices into your operations and marketing strategies to build a robust, relevant, and competitive brand.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:A holistic understanding of the growing business case for sustainability in the fashion industry. Insight into business model theory and the trade-offs of different business models. The ability to move your brand from promise to purpose through a people-centric approach. An understanding of the supply chain’s role in sustainable fashion and global metrics for reporting on sustainability, and tools to create a personalized, engaging narrative that communicates your brand’s sustainability transformation, step by step. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
The fashion industry is known for expediting trends from runway to retail, sometimes at the expense of low-income factory workers and the environment. Thanks to evolving consumer and investor sentiment and events that have exposed the impact of poor production practices, conscious buyers are pushing brands to open up about their supply chain and build more transparent narratives. Now, more than ever, it’s imperative that fashion organizations — from fast fashion to luxury brands — make way for better, more sustainable business models.

The Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program explores the fashion industry’s potential to build purpose-driven and sustainable brands. Guided by expert faculty from SDA Bocconi School of Management, you’ll be introduced to holistic and proactive sustainability practices based on the Environmental, Social and Corporate Governance (ESG) criteria. Explore the need for transparency in the fashion supply chain by examining its structure and challenges. Supported by real-world, global case studies, you’ll also discover how a brand's narrative can be leveraged to address consumer demands for sustainability. The curriculum also includes optional live sessions where you can network with peers and engage with program faculty and educators.

If you’re a business leader or manager looking to build a fashion brand with a positive impact, this program offers you strategic insights and analytical tools to integrate sustainability across your organization. As a marketing or brand professional, this six-week program will equip you with the skills to build a strong brand strategy and narrative that communicates your organization’s sustainability efforts to different stakeholders. Additionally, investors and consultants working in the fashion and luxury sectors, or career newcomers who are ardent social and environmental supporters, can use this program to start or grow in this dynamic industry.

Participants who successfully earn a certificate of completion for the SDA Bocconi Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program may apply to enroll for the Executive Master in Luxury Management (EMiLUX). The Sustainable Fashion: Brand and Business Strategy Program certificate will count toward a segment of the Executive Master. Upon successful admission to the Executive Master, participants will be entitled to receive a discount of €3,000.

Note: Application to the Executive Master in Luxury Management is required and the assessments remain mandatory.

title: Financial Analysis and Management Accounting
partner: The London School of Economics and Political Science
primary_description: Develop a financial and managerial accounting toolkit to drive performance and internal efficiency.
secondary_description: On completion of this course, you’ll walk away with:A fundamental understanding of financial and managerial accounting concepts and principles to inform your business decision-making. The ability to analyse income statements, balance sheets and market information, and communicate the results to stakeholders. Insights into the costs, efficiencies, and profits of a company, and the tools for creating a sustainable culture of improved performance. The capacity to recommend and delegate decision-making authority to foster personal and team responsibility among employees. The skills to design incentive, monitoring, and feedback systems to drive performance and meet organisational targets.
tertiary_description:
In today’s shifting business landscape, a functional understanding of finance and accounting has become an integral part of any influential manager’s toolkit. On the eight-week Financial Analysis and Management Accounting online certificate course from the London School of Economics and Political Science (LSE), you’ll develop a financial and managerial accounting toolkit to drive decision making and enhance organizational performance. With a firm grounding in accounting principles, you’ll improve your ability to analyze statements, and learn how to communicate financial results to key business stakeholders.

With guidance from expert LSE faculty, you’ll discover how insights into your company’s costs, efficiencies, and profits can help create a culture of sustained improvement, and learn how delegating decision-making authority can foster a sense of responsibility in your team. Finally, you’ll assess the role of planning, budgeting, and performance targets, and explore how to design incentive, monitoring, and feedback systems that can achieve them.

Please note this course is geared towards non-financial managers and professionals from a broad range of industries and business areas. Prior knowledge of accounting is not required or expected.

This course will benefit any non-financial manager or professional seeking to develop their accounting skills and knowledge to inform strategy and improve business performance. It’s aimed at individuals with limited accounting knowledge, whether they are new or aspiring managers looking to broaden their financial skill set, business owners or entrepreneurs responsible for organizational decision making, or non-business management professionals wanting to accelerate their career progression. The course isn’t suitable for current finance or accounting professionals.

title: Negotiation Strategies
primary_description: Master the art of collaborative negotiation and learn to maximize the value for all parties in any negotiation scenario.
secondary_description: On completion of this program, you’ll walk away with:Collaborative negotiation techniques and question-asking tools to understand the needs of your negotiation partner and maximize value for both parties. Practical negotiation skills developed through the exploration of strategies, real-world case studies, and common pitfalls. A personalized preparation document for future negotiation scenarios and tangible negotiation practice gained from participating in live online negotiation sessions. An understanding of your own strengths and weaknesses, and a sense of your strongest negotiation style. Unlimited access to edX’s Career Engagement Network, offering you exclusive resources and events to support your professional journey and drive your career forward.
tertiary_description:
In the face of an increasingly tech-driven workplace, there’s been a rise in the need for human capabilities that can’t be replicated by machines. These include creativity, emotional intelligence, and interpersonal skills such as negotiation, which can drive the competitive edge in business.

Collaborative negotiation places the human element at the center of all dealmaking and mediation, ensuring all parties involved feel they have a sense of control and that the outcome is a win-win situation. It also fosters transparency and trust, separates the people from the problem, and sets the tone for future conflict resolutions.

In the Negotiation Strategies online program from the Yale School of Management Executive Education, you’ll gain the practical skills and theoretical knowledge to effectively negotiate in any situation. Over the course of six weeks, you'll explore the principles of negotiation and learn how to turn an opponent into a negotiation partner. Whether you’re negotiating contracts and agreements, influencing major organizational decisions, or looking to better maintain relationships with clients and colleagues, you’ll benefit from developing a robust, but considerate, style of negotiation.

This program is designed for business professionals aiming to improve their negotiation, strategic communication, conflict resolution, and management skills, as well as enhance their ability to make deals and better understand how to resolve issues like disclosure. Professionals such as business owners, executives, directors, and managers who need to negotiate contracts and agreements such as job offers, promotions, asset purchases, or resource allocations will benefit from the tools and techniques covered during the course of this program. Those in roles such as product management, sales and marketing, business development, contract management, and procurement will find particular value in this program. Aspiring leaders, team and project managers, and specialists such as lawyers and accountants, can also use the techniques to effectively manage stakeholders and client relationships.
